She is a farmer who specializes mainly in dairy farming, and she also raises chickens, a business she has been running for the last 13 years. To enable her to buy feeds for her cows and chickens, she has applied for her first loan of Kshs 100,000 from Kadet Ltd.

From the sale of milk and eggs, she makes a monthly income of about Kshs 40,000. She intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to construct some rental houses for more income. She hopes for a fulfilled future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and poultry feeds.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married with three children, ages 3, 6 and 8. He pays tuition for two of them, using the income that he earns from the sale of produce. He sells locally-made gin to supplement his income. Having two businesses has helped him to get enough income to provide for his family.

George has now approached Ugafode for another loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy local gin that is a delicacy among the locals. Initially he took UGX 1,000,000 to buy produce; however, he says the demand for local gin is now high.

He has promised to pay back the loan after the sale of the gin. However, George faces challenges like seasonality and competition, especially when his income from produce is unreliable.

loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Esther. She is friendly and works very hard to take care of her family. She lives at home with her mother, father and twin sister. She runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Chilanga, a town located 20 km away from the Zambian capital city of Lusaka.

Before running her own mobile money business, Esther worked as a cashier for a lending financial institution. She used her salary to take herself to school and obtained a certificate in Banking and Finance. Her experience helps her in the day-to-day running of her business. 

Esther says her community benefits from her business of mobile money transfers because they do not have to travel to the big city of Lusaka, as they used to in the past to access financial services. She is very pleased with the business because it allows her to have a minimum income at the end of the month to pay for rentals.

Esther is pleased to be connected to the Kiva lenders and have the opportunity to access working capital support. She explains that even though she has been running her business for three years now, it has not experienced a lot of growth. This is due to the fact the she does not have enough money in her business to serve customers who want to send and receive larger amounts of money. Currently, Esther is operating with a very low amount of capital reserves. This is not enough because mobile money is becoming more popular and the demand for the product has increased.

Esther is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can grow her business, by adding money to enable her to serve more customers. With increased working capital, Esther is confident she can earn additional profits, grow her business, and provide better for herself and family.

loans.use: to add more money to serve more customers who need to access financial services at her booth.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old and is married. Together with his wife, he has two young children who are 2 and 1 year old.

James has a motorcycle business that he has been running for several years. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to service his motorcycle. 

He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the near future.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mondayma

texts.en:
Mondayma lives in Paynesville, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 37 years old and unmarried. She has two children who are 15 and 16 years old, and they are in school and live at home. 

Mondayma did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with a business by selling butter and bread to improve her living conditions. She started this business with a little money from her fiancée ten years ago. She said that having fewer goods on her table is the only challenge she faces for now. 

She likes her business because it is profitable. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She said that she is proud of her business because it is the only means by which she can make money. Mondayma said that with the loan she is going to buy more butter and bread to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more butter and bread to resell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is 26 years old, a wife and a mother of one. She is also a business lady and she runs her own cosmetics business that has been in operation for the last 6 months. She started the business from her personal savings with a contribution from her husband. 

She knew about Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy hair relaxers and hair oil for her business. She hopes that in the next five years she will grow the business into a company dealing with cosmetic solutions. She also wants to open other branches of the business and be able to run more businesses. The income she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers and hair oil.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 40-year-old single lady who has been employed in a clothes-selling shop since seven years ago. Her low monthly salary isn't enough income to cover her sudden unexpected needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua: to pay for her medical needs.

She hopes to move forward for a better future.

loans.use: To pay for her medical needs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 49 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de antojitos típicos (yuca frita, pastelitos de carne, etc.) y así es como ha logrado salir adelante y llevar la economía a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena y cemento para repellar pared y encementar el piso. Tiene la seguridad de que con su venta de antojitos logrará sacar las cuotas del crédito.
texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old. She has lived in a house on her own property together with her family for a long time. For the past five years she has been selling traditional snacks like fried plantain, meat pies etc. This is how she has gotten ahead and raised the family's economy. 

With the goal of improving the condition of her house Cristina is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and to cement in her floor. She is certain that with the sales of the snacks she will be able to meet the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and cement in the floor.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en: Mgeni appreciates the previous loan which helped her to increase her stock. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more fruits to make juice and detergents for soap preparation. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make juice and detergents for soap preparation.

loans.name: Topi

texts.en:
Topi, a 38-year-old divorced mother of two children aged 13 and 18, has been a hairdresser since 1998 in order to meet her family's needs, which include her children's school fees. Topi's main challenge is the fact that bigger customers, for example those having parties, prefer bigger salons. She thus needs to improve hers.

Having been granted an initial loan of ugx 300,000= from Ugafode, Topi is requesting a new one for ugx.500, 000= in order to buy more salon items. Her  dream is to develop her business into a bigger one in order to meet customer demand in the town of Kagadi and the neighboring area.

loans.use: To buy salon items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 37 years old and married. They are blessed with two children, who are in school. She has a grocery business in Naivasha, which she has been running for three years. She makes an average income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings and has applied for a first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to purchase stock such as bananas, potatoes, and tomatoes among others. She plans to boost her business and also pay school fees with the anticipated profit from her expanded business. In the near future, she hopes to be financially stable and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en el  ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Nilda quien hizo su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y trabaja por ir mejorando su trabajo y su situación de pobreza, y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual está mejorando sus ingresos y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Nilda Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos  en general, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, productos a granel y demás,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Los niños que están en la fotografía son hijos de nuestros clientes. en la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas, ya que el grupo tiene mas miembros que en esta ocasión no retiran crédito pero que forman parte del comité.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" is in its 7th loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program of Fundación Paraguaya.  They are also participating in the institution's poverty elimination program, putting in maximum effort to improve their poverty situation.

One of the members is Nilda.  She took the poverty elimination survey, and is working to improve her business and her financial situation.  She comments that she has a well-stocked store, with which she is increasing her income and helping her family.

Nilda is requesting this loan to buy general products such as vegetables, meat, fruit, and other bulk products.  This will help her to carry out her plans for her business, which will help her to increase her income.  The children in the photograph are the children of the members.  In the photo there are more people shown than are taking this loan, because there are some members who will not be taking a loan at this time, but they are part of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, and other bulk products

loans.name: Esperanza  De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” conformada por 08 socios responsables y unidos, la cual pasan a su 08 ciclo. El Sr. Guillermo de 56 años es viudo y tiene 04 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. El se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina ambulatoriamente. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus 02 menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ollas, tenedores y platos. El deseo de Guillermo es de instalar un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos. El grupo “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” esta agradecidos con el apoyo brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso. Guillermo se encuentra de pie, es el primero del lado izquierdo y viste una camiseta color azul.
texts.en:
Meet the “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” group. Composed of 8 members it is going into it's 8th cycle. 

Guillermo is 56 years old. He is a widower and has 4 children, two of them still dependent on him. He sells kitchen utensils door to door. Through his work and efforts he has been able to improve his house and support his two dependent children. 

Guillermo is requesting this loan to buy pots, forks and plates. His wish is to set up a place where he can display his wares. 

The “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” group is grateful for the support offered them which makes it possible for them to progress. Guillermo is the first person on the left, wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy pots, forks and plates.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: Rafaela de 52 años de edad habita en casa propia junto  a su grupo familiar. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes pero está contenta de poder contar con una casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de camarones y pescado fresco desde hace tres años y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la reparación del techo y las paredes de su vivienda. Con el crédito comprará lámina  galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que las condiciones del techo de su vivienda requieren de la reparación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rafaela, 52 years old, lives in her own home along with her family. Her living conditions are very humble, but she is happy to be able to have her own home. She has worked selling fresh shrimp and fish for three years, and she makes a living this way to support her home.

With the goal of improving her living conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSIA to invest in the repairs of the roof and walls of her home. With the loan she will purchase galvanized corrugated metal, wood, and nails. She hopes to be able to count on this financial support since the condition of the roof of her home requires repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase: galvanized corrugated metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof and walls of her home.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 21 years old and a single mother of two whom she supports. She is into the milk-trade business in Kericho town. This has been her income-generating business for the last five years. She gets an average monthly income of 150,000 KES [Kenyan shillings].

She has borrowed a loan of 100,000 KES, and she plans to use the amount borrowed to purchase more milk for resale and a small cooler to preserve the milk before she sells it. Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education. She also hopes to expand her business and purchase a milk-processing machine and a cooling plant.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for resale and a small cooler to preserve it.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a woman of forty-seven years. She is a widow and has four children, and she does horticultural farming in Limuru. She has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand eight hundred shillings. 

This will be Mary’s third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans use the entire loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings etc. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous business woman so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zolia Alejandra

texts.es:
Zoila es una joven de 21 años con muchas ganas de poder mejorar su calidad, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con cuyos ingresos la ayudan mucho para poder sacar adelante a su hijo.

Zolia agradece el apoyo qu ele brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería para su bodega como atún, fideos, gaseosas, productos de bazar entre otros y así poder salir adelante y luchar ´por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Zolia is a young woman, 21 years old, who strongly wishes to improve the quality of her life. Above all, this is because she is the mother of a small child who is 3 years old. With much effort, she managed to begin her small business selling groceries, and that income greatly helps her to be able to bring her son out ahead.

Zolia is thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders provide since thanks to this she will be able to purchase merchandise for her small grocery store such as tuna, noodles, sodas, and stationery products, among others, and so be able to go on and fight to make her dream a reality: “To have her own home.”

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 68-year-old married lady. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter in a small village within the Lanchkhuti district. Marina gets orders and makes plural cosmetics to sell. Her son is a physical worker and earns little income. The family lives in poverty as they have not enough income to cover everyday expenses. Marina decided to purchase cows and start a husbandry business. The start-up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,500 to purchase cows. She will also build the shed for the cows with the credit received, so the family can  start their husbandry business. Marina and her daughter-in-law will produce dairy products to sell and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase cows and build a shed for them.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, age 35, is from Samtredia district. She lives alone in her own house, and works as a salesperson at the optics store. She gets a monthly salary there; nearly $120.

Khatuna is a hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead. Her salary is not enough for saving and improving her standard of living. Khatuna has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and linens at wholesale prices and start a sales business among her co-workers and community members. 

Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Khatuna's business will have high demand. She will be very nice to her customers and will be able to get more profits. Khatuna will invest the profits in the same business, and increase the turnover gradually. This start up loan is a good chance for Khatuna to earn a stable income and improve her living conditions in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang is a 60-year-old man and a responsible father of six children. He is involved in the agriculture businesses, and he raises pigs and farms rice. He has been in this business for years with some help from his children and wife. His wife, who shares the goal of developing their living standard and helping their children in their future education, contributes her income earned by weaving baskets to sell in local markets of the province. Recently their son, Raksmey aged 18 (pictured), graduated from high school and passed his exam with grade C. Raksmey wants to continue his chemistry studies at Royal University of Phnom Penh. He loves to study in this field and wants to become a high school chemistry teacher. 

At this time, Mang has applied for a loan to pay for the university tuition fees of his son. With this loan, he can now accommodate the expenses of his son. Raksmey, pictured here, will be furthering his education with the funds from this loan.  His father, who is not included in the picture, is applying for the loan from Kiva and will be responsible for principal repayments. He thanks lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partner HKL to push students to get better education.

loans.use: pay for the University tuition fees of his son.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is a hardworking and married woman with six children. She is 45 years old, and a farmer in Svay Rieng province. She owns and manages around two-hectare land, primarily growing and harvesting rice to sell. She has been doing farming for nearly 30 years. Through her hardships, she aims to uplift this family out of poverty and educate all her children at school.

Sarun would like to have enough energy for household and reduce monthly expenses by purchasing a set of solar home system for installing at her home. Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a loan in the amount of KHR 1,600,000 from Kiva through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Sarun hopes to have clean energy to support her household appliances, such as light, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for installing at her home.

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es: Walter de  23 años de edad es un joven muy trabajador y responsable. Él se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 8 años. Aprendió este oficio ya que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando. Este oficio es el que le permite colaborar con la economía de su familia. Walter habita en casa muy humilde pero propia la cual desea hacerle cambio de techo ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias se ha deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para hacer el cambio de techo lo antes posible. Tiene plena confianza que con los ingresos que percibe de los trabajos que realiza de albañilería logrará cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Walter is a 23 year old young man who is very responsible and hard-working. He has been working as a bricklayer for the past 8 years. He learned this trade as he couldn't continue his studies due to a lack of resources. This work allows him to contribute to the family's economy. 

Walter lives in a house that is his own but is very modest. He wants to replace the roof as it has deteriorated from the rain and the passing of time. Walter is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting and wood to replace the roof as soon as possible. He is fully confident that with the work he does as a bricklayer he will be able to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa de comité, tiene 19 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo que practican entre ellas la  solidaridad, ayuda mutua y responsabilidad, todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora Basilica de 45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace muchos años por la ciudad y con esta actividad pudo sacar adelante a su familia ya que la misma posee una clientela formada, ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder ir mejorando y luchando por el bien de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, y así seguir creciendo en su trabajo y también poder mejorar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Mujeres Trabajadoras is in its first cycle of the committee’s program. It has 19 members currently. It is a group that among its members practices solidarity, mutual help, and responsibility. All of them are very hard-working and tenacious.

One of the stories worthy of highlighting is that of Basilica, who is 45 years old. She has made a living selling clothes for many years throughout the city, and with this activity she was able to bring her family out ahead since she has a well-formed customer base. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue improving and fighting for the wellbeing of her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a variety of items, such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more, and so continue expanding her work and also be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, such as jeans, t shirts, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Taghareed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 28-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in manufacturing and selling special perfumes since three years ago. In March 2013, she started her own business inside her house to take good care of her beloved baby, and at the same time, develop her newly established business gradually.

Taghreed is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise by adding special released essences that will help her develop her business in a well managed way.

Taghreed is well known in her region by her good reputation and the hard work she puts to support her husband in their living. She hopes that in the future, she'll be capable of opening a wider perfume shop outside her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by adding special released essences to develop her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Steven is 35 years old and engaged to marry his partner, Kombe. He lives in a rented house with his older sister. His background is in mechanics but now Steven successfully runs a Zoona mobile money transfers business in Lusaka, Zambia.  

Steven began his business a year ago with limited start up capital. Through hard work he has doubled his capital but it is still not what is necessary to service all his customers' needs to transfer money. Steven cannot service anyone wanting to send or receive larger sums of money due to his limited funds. The reason for the loan is so Steven can increase his working capital in order to service more customers and earn additional profit. 
 
Steven loves running his business because it provides an easy way for people to transfer their money.  He uses some of the earnings from his shop to support his siblings and pay for utility bills.  He is very hopeful that once his loan comes in, he will earn more profits and be able to provide for his soon-to-be wife.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business and serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Emelia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling vegetable, fish, and food items at Bimponaso  (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Emelia is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay for their children’s school fees. 

Emelia wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of vegetables and smoked fish. In the long term, Emelia plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of vegetables and smoked fish.

loans.name: Geovanny Alexander

texts.es: Geovanny de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre quien depende de él. Desde hace 5 años trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y ayudar a su madre con los gastos de alimentación. Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas. Gracias a su responsabilidad y carisma ha logrado hacer muchos clientes y cada día sus productos son más demandados. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo y arena ya que desea construir una pila con baño y lavadero. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y poder hacer la construcción de la pila lo antes posible ya que es bien necesaria para reguardar el agua de uso diario.
texts.en:
Geovanny is 21 years old. He lives in his own home with his mother who is dependent on him. For the past five years he has been working hard making a living and helping his mother with the food expenses. He makes and sells hammocks. Thanks to his responsibility and charisma he has managed to gain lots of clients. Day by day his product is more in demand. 

Geovanny is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, bricks and sand as he wants to construct a sink as soon as possible. It is a necessity for storing water for their everyday use.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick and sand to construct a sink complete with a water holding tank and a clothes washing station.

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
Kasaine is 57 years old, married to Jane, and together they are blessed with seven children who are in school.

He is in the farming business in Naivasha, which he has practiced for ten years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the near future, he hopes to increase his farm output on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is glad to be connected with supporters of BRAC Liberia. This has been a great helps for her and her children. She said that with this loan: "I will be able to pay my children's school fees and have some money at home". 

Betty is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville South. She is married with four children, ages between 6 and 22, who are attending school and living at home. Over the past 16 years, she has been selling charcoal by bag from a shop.

Betty has requested this loan to purchase more charcoal by bag to increase her sales even more. She points out low inventory as her challenge in business. She started this business by helping her mother in her shop. In the near future, she likes to have her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by bag to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en: Ramaz is a 65-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo district with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two granddaughters. His wife is a teacher at a local school and gets 300 GEL per month. Ramaz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a cow and two calves, whose milk is used in making cheese products to sell. Ramaz decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3200. With the received credit he will purchase building materials and will build a greenhouse, where he will sow cucumbers and tomatoes to sell. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Road To Success Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Road To Success” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 2,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mohamed is again the featured leader of this group; his former group member has decided not to collect a new loan this time, so Mohamed has brought a new member into the loan group. Mohamed is pleased to inform Kiva lenders that his previous Kiva loan has been very helpful to him, enabling him to buy a large quantity of used bags to add to his business. He has requested this new loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: After graduating middle school form four, Justina decided to set up her own wakye selling business. (Wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves.) She prepares her wakye on her own and proceeds to sell it in Bimponaso, near Twifo Praso. With over 25 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty wakye. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband, who is a teacher, with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their six children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans to prepare and sell more of her tasty wakye.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is married and has four children. After successfully graduating primary school, Paulina is now an established businesswoman. She sells smoked  fish in Bimponaso, near Twifo Praso. She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. Paulina uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the entire family. Paulina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish to smoke and sell, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she  plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es: Julio de 43 años de edad habita junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad y un hijo de 14 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para salir adelante y llevar la economía a su hogar. Trabaja como albañil y a la fecha ya cuenta con muchos clientes ya que se caracteriza por ser un hombre honesto, responsable y dedicado en lo que hace. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia, solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la casa ya que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra y moja sus pocas pertenencias. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Julio, age 43, lives together with his spouse, 17 year-old daughter, and 14 year-old son.  He has worked hard all his life to get ahead and take care of the finances of his home.  He works as a builder and, at this point, has many clients due to being an honest and responsible man dedicated to what he does.  

With the goal of improving the living conditions of his family, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of his house’s roof. It has deteriorated, and when it rains, water comes in and gets his few belongings wet. With the loan, he will buy galvanized sheets of metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets of metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta lives in Montserrado county, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 year old, and married with three children between 12 and 14 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past twelve years, she has been selling rice and coal in the community market. She started this business with help from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 8 hours each day in her business, and uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She called herself a strong business woman, and she likes her business because it gives her additional money. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice and coal to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice and coal to expand her sales.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Abdul. He is married, and has 1 child aged 9 months. 

In 2011, Abdul established his compressor, gas, and freezer business. He began his business because his mother was doing the same business.  After he completed his university education, he work for sometime and saved the money used to start his business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,060,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more freezers, gas and compressors. In the future, Abdul plans to buy a piece of land, become an international businessman and to give his children a quality education. Some debtors not paying on the agreed date is one challenge. Abdul is a hardworking man and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more freezers, gas and compressors.

loans.name: Elvis Wilfredo

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 45 años y vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Elvis trabaja como albañil y con el fruto de su trabajo saca adelante a su familia ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, Elvis cree que le va bien porque es muy detallista en su trabajo y por ello no tienen quejas de sus clientes.

Elvis esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familia, sobre todo porque sus hijos son pequeños, así seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Elvis is 45 years old and lives in the Tinguiña district. Elvis works as a bricklayer. This is his only source of income and with it he has been able to get his family ahead. Elvis feels things are going well for him as he is very meticulous in his work and he doesn't get complaints from his customers. 

Elvis is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they offer him, he can buy materials to make improvements on his house. This will improve the quality of living for his family, especially for his younger children. So he can continue to work to achieve his goal which is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Reyna Marisol

texts.es: Reyna de 27 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de ropa nueva. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia para ello desea mejorar su vivienda ya que en la actualidad las paredes son de plástico y el techo se encuentra dañado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo y las paredes de su vivienda y así dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 27 years old. She lives in a house on her own property together with her husband and two children, aged 3 and 8. For the past 5 years she has been making a living by selling a variety of new clothing. She wants to improve the living conditions of her family and to do this she wants to improve her house. The walls are now made of plastic and the roof has deteriorated. 

Reyna is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof and the walls of her house in order to provide more security for her family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof and walls of her house.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Mariatu A. She is married and has 2 school going children, ages 8 and 5 years old. In 2008, Mariatu A. established her business of local food stuff, such as beans, pepper, cola nuts, palm oil, etc. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunt who was an experienced business woman. She told her it will be an advantage if she takes her trade, as she has no children, and relies so much on her niece to handle her business activities. 

Even though she did not go to school, she learned a lot from her aunt. Working 5 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 706,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mariatu A. requires the loan in order to purchase bags of pepper and beans. 

In the future, Mariatu A. plans to develop her business and educate her children to college level. Changes in prices are her major challenges. She thanks ARD for the opportunity given to her in accessing a loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of beans, pepper, cola nuts, and gallons palm oil.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Abibatu. She is married, and has 3 children aged 11, 7, 5 years; all are school children. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her and helps her in domestic work.  

In 2002, Abibatu established her Local Food Stuffs (pepper, palm oil, groundnut, cola nuts etc.) business. She began her business because her parents were divorced, she was brought up by her grandmother, and she took up responsibility at an early age. Her grandmother was a petty trader and could not afford to pay her school fees. Abibatu was hawking from one place to another with the business; there she learned a lot about surviving through hardship. 

Working 5 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,686,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase gallons of palm oil. In the future, Abibatu plans to develop her business and educate her children.  Inadequate capital for her business is her main problem. Accessing a loan will help her a lot. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 25-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, two infant children, mother and grandmother in a small village of Mtskheta district. The family runs a small shop, which is placed near their house. They sell groceries and food stuffs, such as sugar, flour and so on. This is the only source of income for the family, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. George decided to purchase a car and start a taxi business. The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $2700 to purchase a car. When the car is purchased, he will serve people as a taxi driver and will be able to increase his income. With the increased income he will provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has 4 children, ages 26, 24, 20 and 18 years; 2 of them are school-going children. In 1990, Memunatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she came from a poor background; to afford food for the family was difficult, let alone pay school fees. She was sent to a distant relative to help in her hawking business. She was glad to leave, knowing that she has lessened her parents’ burden. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 533,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Memunatu requires the loan in order to purchase dozens of clothing and jewellings. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to improve her business. Competition is her major challenge. She is grateful for being given the opportunity to access a loan from ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bails of clothing.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in the Mariakani area in Kenya. She is 35 years old and married, a businesslady with three children. 

She sells a deep fried dough called "maandazi" locally. She has been doing this business for the last three years, and her business has been growing over the years. She started this business from the money generated from a sweet potato business that she was doing. 

She found Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. The challenges in the business include price changes and inflation. 

She will use the income that she raises from the business to pay school fees for her children and also to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Sam Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Sam”; it is made up of four ladies. This group demonstrates initiative, values, and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays.  

Fawzia is 56 years old and married, with two children. She is the leader of this group, and she lives in Aden, Yemen. 

She is a merchant; specifically, she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She has been doing this for two years. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where prices are cheaper. She started this business because of the lack of a clothing market in her neighborhood. 

She is very grateful to her neighbors who have supported her over all these years. With the income from her business, she was able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comforts. 

She has applied for a loan of YER 80,000 from AMB to acquire more clothing, such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

loans.use: to acquire more clothing, such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en:
Nazra is a 49-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a laborer; the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Brima. He is married and has 6 children, ages 29, 27, 25, 23, 18 and 16 years; 2 are school-going children. In 1983, Brima established his ceramic household utensils business. He began his business because, as he attained a High School Diploma without a job easily, he decided to join his uncle in business because he could not further his studies. His uncle took him and he was trained to be a responsible and hardworking business man.

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 680,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Brima requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of ceramic household utensils. 

In the future, Brima plans to educate his two children to university level and improve his business. This loan will help him achieve his plans, as it will add to his income. Changes in prices are his major challenge. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks ARD for the support in financing his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of ceramic household utensils.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 2 children, ages 10 and 8 years respectively, and all are school-going children. In 2010, Fatmata established her electrical accessories business. She began her business because she left school voluntarily at Form 3 level. Her elder brother sent money for her from abroad to start a business.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,150,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy travelling boxes, musical sets, and mobile phones. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open another outlet, buy piece of land, and build for her children and educate them. This loan will help her achieve some of her future plans. Inadequate capital for her business is the main problem. She is a hardworking business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy travelling boxes, musical sets, and mobile phones.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is an experienced agronomist from Dimitrov village of Ararat region. He lives with his wife and three daughters (8, 7 and 3 years old). To take care of his family, Armen is engaged in breeding a piglet and in cultivation of corn, cabbage, watermelon and apricot. He has three greenhouses where he cultivates plants. 

Armen's wife assists him greatly with the farming activities. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

To be able to continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Armen needs a loan of $3,000 to renovate the greenhouse, to purchase some forage for the piglet and to buy fertilizers, lettuce seeds, some cellophane and some fuel for the greenhouse. The loan will help him maintain and develop his agribusiness. 

Armen and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their help in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse, to purchase some forage for the piglet and to buy fertilizers, lettuce seeds, some cellophane and some fuel for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 22-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store with her husband, who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of one child and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy packs of salts, biscuits and toffees to deal with more customers time after time. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and toffees.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan, age 32, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past 10 years. Over time, she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her five children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy packs of salts, oil, grains and juices to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, oil, grains and juices.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is from the village of Taperakan in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. She works in the local village school as a teacher. Her husband works in the government sector. The two of them work hard to earn a living for the family. Kristine is engaged in agriculture and in viticulture. It’s more than ten years since the family first started cultivating grapes. They have an established agribusiness and realize their products in the local market. Kristine’s husband helps her greatly concerning the organizational issues of the agribusiness. 

As the autumn is progressing they need to prepare their vineyard for the cold weather. The procedure requires financial investment. Kristine needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase cable and pipes, to pay for the workforce and for the water bills. The preparation will make the viticulture more productive and help them sustain their agribusiness. Kristine and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cable and pipes and pay for the workforce and the water bills to prepare her vineyard for the Autumn.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts in recent years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is from the village of Nshavan in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband (in the photo), daughter and son. She works in the village local self-governance body as an accountant, and her husband works in the private sector. The two of them are the main breadwinners of the family and work hard to be able to cover their family’s needs. Their salaries, however, are not enough to meet their needs. Anahit and her family members are also engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and hens and in the cultivation of wheat, greens, peaches, apricots, and quince. Anahit’s son helps her realize the agricultural products in the local market, which in an important source of income for the family. As the family’s needs are growing day by day, Anahit wants to expand her agribusiness to more effectively cover her family’s costs. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase two steers, to buy some fodder for the livestock, to buy wheat seeds, and to pay for the harvesting services. Anahit and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, to buy some foee34 for the livestock, to buy wheat seeds and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Loma De La Cruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Loma de la Cruz está formado por 2 socios y 10 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy reconocida por la belleza colonial y su cultural, esta bañada por 4 ríos, siendo Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, su gente es amable, gentil. Las socias trabajan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares, siempre luchan por el bienestar de sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Narcisa, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Loma de la Cruz, espera poder establecer una muy buena amistad con todas las integrantes y salir de su rutina de trabajo.
La Señora. Narcisa tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 9 hijos, tres de sus hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, dos de sus hijos solteros viven independientes, dos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y dos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña Narcisa labora a diario lavando ropa ajena, también en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos negocio el cual le permite solventar sus gastos.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para  pollos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Las fotos pequeñas son de tres integrantes del grupo que pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto grupal.
texts.en:
The "Loma de la Cruz" communal bank is composed of two males and ten females who lives around the city of Cuenca. This city is famous for it's colonial beauty and it's culture. It has four rivers running through it and was granted World Heritage Site status in December 1999. It's people are friendly and gentle. The members of the communal bank work hard every day to strengthen their household, always fighting for the well-being of their families. 

Narcisa, one of these members, is requesting her first loan alongside her friends and associates of the "Loma de la Cruz" communal bank. She hopes to establish a strong friendship with all the members and continue with her work routine. She is 53 years old and the single mother of nine children. Three of her children are married and live independently. Two of her single children also live apart. Two others work and help with the household economy and the last two study at a secondary school in the city. They live in a rented house.

Narcisa works daily bringing in laundry to wash and also raises chickens at her house which allows her to pay her expenses. The money from the loan will be used to buy chicks and chicken feed. 

Her dream is to have her own house. The three inserted photos are members of the group who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en: Aasia is a 37-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store she is requesting a loan for PKR 30,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour at lower rates. In this way she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en: Nzalambi lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a wife, mother of six children and a business lady. She makes brooms out of the local grasses. She also buys brooms made by her friends and later sells them at a profit. She started her business two years ago and it has been growing as the days go by. She learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more grass materials for her business. She hopes that the business will grow and develop in the next five years. The major challenge that she faces in the business is the season that can sometimes cause the income during that time to be very low. She will use the profits she will earn from the business to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more grass materials.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 48-year-old, vigorous, married woman. Her husband is a farmer whose income is not sufficient to cover their household expenses alone. That is why Shazia took an initiative to support her husband financially by stitching clothes for the people of her community. She uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to meet the demands of her customers in a timely manner. This is her 2nd loan cycle and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Vruyr

texts.en:
Vruyr is an agronomist form Goris city of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, school-age daughter, and 3-year-old son. Vruyr's wife works in the private sector. 

Vruyr is engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets and in beekeeping. He realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

His agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to become more productive and to develop in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 1,500 will help Vruyr greatly, enabling him to purchase ten beehives and five piglets. 

He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Vruyr was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. 

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Vruyr and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets and ten beehives

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 55-year-old farmer who lives in Kericho. She is a mother of eight children, and has been doing farming for the past 30 years. She is involved in planting tea and rearing dairy cows, and she gets her income from milk and tea. She loves dairy farming the most because of the output received from the cows. 

She chose Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase a water tank with the loan given to her. This loan will benefit her family by increasing their income through the increase of output due to the easy availability of water.

Eunice wishes to invest with Juhudi Kilimo because of the growth that she has experienced.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Tegh village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter and father-in-law. She works as a librarian in the village's local school. With the help of her family members, Naira is also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture and in the cultivation of wheat and grass. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the most important source of income for them. 

As the family's needs are growing with time, Naira needs to expand her agribusiness in order to take care of her family's needs more effectively. A loan of $3,000 will help her reach that goal, enabling her to purchase three cows. Naira and her family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for helping them collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 31 years old and married to Sera.  Together they are blessed with five children, who are in school.

He is in the farming business in Naivasha, which he has practiced for 11 years.. He has applied for hiis first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seeds during this planting season. 

With his anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children.  In the near future, he hopes to be among the top farmers in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting season

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 12 years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Hannah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling African-print cloth in Bimponaso (near Twio Praso). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years.  

Hannah  is married and has six children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Hannah wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of African-print cloth. In the long term, Hannah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of African-print cloth.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old and married to Francis. Together they are blessed with one child, aged 1 year.

She has a grocery business in Naivasha, which she has been running for three years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to purchase stock such as bananas, mangoes and oranges, among other items. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business. 

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest fruit shop in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy bananas, mangoes and oranges, among other items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother, 33 years old, with two children. She lives in Kyotera town with her kids, who are 16 and 14.

She is a business woman who operates a beauty salon. She works seven days week, and each day she works for ten hours so she can maximise sales. Agnes supplements her income with a salary she earns from working as a school canteen attendant.

She has been in the business of her salon since 2007.  She started it so that she could earn a living and be able to raise her kids well, being a single mother. 

She has requested this loan so she can boost her salon by adding different cosmetic products since it’s towards Christmas season.


She offers her services to residents around Kyotera town. And her biggest hope is to enlarge her salon business such that she can be able to dress brides, which will increase her profits. However, like any other business, Agnes faces the challenges of limited capital and a standstill of business, since it’s seasonal. And she describes herself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family.

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to her increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa  is a small-scale baker who bakes bread for sale and also operates a provisions shop  in Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer.   

Adjoa has been working as a baker  for  close to  six years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions and flour, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of provisions and flour

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn, a rural villager from Kampong Chnang province's Kampong Leng District where rice farming is a popular business in the neighborhood, is 37 years old and she has three children, two of whom are still in school. Sorphorn has been growing sesame and also selling fish and grocery items. The current business earns her about $55 per day but she can save about $7 each day after daily expenses.  

This is her first cycle as a client with VIsionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay the tuition fee for her son’s university. She greatly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her oldest son to university to obtain a higher education and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son’s university

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarmen

texts.en:
Sarmen is a young farmer from Goris city in the Syuniq region. He lives with his parents. Sarmen's mother works in the private sector. To take care of his family, Sarmen is engaged in beekeeping. His father helps him in his everyday activities related to beekeeping. Sarmen sells the honey in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. Honey is a product in very high demand, particularly if it comes from the family's area. 

To continue beekeeping in a sustainable way, Sarmen needs to make some investments in it. He needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase twenty beehives and to pay for the renovation and transportation of the beehives. He has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Sarmen has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Sarmen and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase twenty beehives and to pay for the renovation and transportation of the beehives

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 26 years old, married to Charles, and together they are blessed with two children who are below the age of schooling.

She has a boutique business in Naivasha which she has been running for two years; she has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to purchase a stock of clothing to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business.

In the near future, she hopes to be successful in her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jindan

texts.en:
Jindan is a 52-year-old married woman, and has five children.  She has been weaving sweaters for almost 8 years now.  She works hard on her weaver every day so she can earn a living for her family to provide food, healthcare, and education.  

Jindan is requesting her sixth loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.  With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and has had positive  repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has three cows and three buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Irshad has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her, and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Estrellitas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Estrellitas está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos que la cobijan, su geografía accidentada le regala hermoso paisajes, su Centro Histórico le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999. Su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres que día a día se encuentra en la lucha para mejorar su estabilidad económica para poder salir adelante con sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Estrellitas, a este grupo ha sido invitado por su madre quien ya forma parte desde hace algún tiempo, siendo su expectativa de ayudarse solidariamente en el grupo.
La Señora Blanca tiene 42 años de edad está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 25, 20 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es profesor, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Blanca desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de limpiones, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario, también desde hace dos meses se dedica a cuidar de dos niños por las tardes. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de limpiones para ampliar su mercadería. Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrellitas is made up of 6 female members and 1 male member  who live in the city of Cuenca.  This city enjoys a chilly climate. It is flanked by four rivers that surround it; its uneven geography gives it beautiful landscapes. The historic downtown became a World Heritage site in December of 1999.  Like the members of the group, its people are women who daily find themselves in the fight to improve their economic stability in order to get their families ahead, while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the group members is Señora Blanca, who is taking out her first loan alongside her friends and fellow group members from the Estrellita communal bank.  Her mother, who had already been a member of the group for some time, had invited her to join, with the hope of mutual help in the group.

Señora Blanca is 42 years old. She is married and from her marriage has three children, ages 25, 20, and 15 years.  Her first child is studying in the university, and the younger two children study in a school in the city. Her husband is a teacher. They don’t have their own house so they rent.

For five years, Doña Blanca has worked selling cleaning cloths.  She works from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  She has also worked for the past two months caring for two children during the afternoons.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of cleaning cloths to expand her merchandise.  Her goal is to finish her university studies.

The small photo is of a group member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cleaning cloths

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
Ruth vive en al ciudad de camana, para poder tener ingresos trabaja como obrera agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad y con este trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, Ruth cree que le va bien en el trabajo porque es muy trabajadora y responsable.

Ruth esta agradecida con los prestamisas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y poder apoyar con mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in Camana. She makes a living working in agriculture at a property in her city. This job allows her to help her parents with the household expenses. Ruth believes that it is going well at work because she is very hard-working and responsible. 

Ruth is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she will be able to pay for some personal purchases as well as to contribute to some improvements on the house. This way she will be able to continue working in order to achieve her dream: "To run her own business".

loans.use: to make improvements on her house and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Kirn

texts.en:
Kirn is a 32-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children.  She has been in the beauty parlor business for two years.  She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the last two years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  She deals with more customers every day.  

To meet this growing demand, she has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.  She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Virtuosas  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité, ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza se puede saber las condiciones de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia quien realiza venta de comestible, teniendo su propia producción, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Es una persona que pese a las dificultades está luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para la producción de comidas, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo sus comestibles y de esa forma poder deleitando a sus clientes con sus deliciosas comidas, esto la ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas group is in its third cycle with the committee program.  They are a part of the elimination of poverty program.  Through the elimination of poverty survey they are able to learn about each of their life conditions.

Antonia is one of the members.  She produces and sells food.  She is a very hard-working woman.  She is getting ahead through her effort and sacrifice.  She is a person who, in spite of the difficulties, is struggling to improve her life and that of her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy materials to produce food.  She will be able to continue making her food with these materials.  This way she will be able to delight her customers with her delicious food.  This will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce food.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de omite de mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Luque, donde todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando sus vidas por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una persona digna de destacar es Lucia, quien se dedica a la costura, y comenta que por medio de su lucha diaria está dando a su familia lo que necesitan para poder cubrir los gastos del día a día. Ella se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que todos sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con las confecciones que hace, y así va mejorando y creciendo en su pequeño emprendimiento.
