La Sra. Lucia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, y así seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su trabajo. Ella sueña con poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Rita [communal bank] is in its 7th cycle of the women’s communal bank program.  All of the women are friends and neighbors in the city of Luque, where each and every one of them is putting forth her best effort to be able to improve their lives by working together.

One person worth noticing is Lucia, who works as a seamstress and says that through her daily efforts she is giving her family what they need to cover day-to-day expenses.  She has built a very good clientele because all of her customers are always very pleased with her sewing, and so she goes on improving and growing her small enterprise.

Señora Lucia is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, and other items, and thus to keep working and fighting to improve her work.  She dreams of being able to improve her life and the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Here is Betty from Liberia; she lives in Sinkor. She is 40 years old, and she is married to a house builder. They have three children between 4 and 20 years old. They are in school and live at home.  Betty did not attend school.

For seven years now, she has been selling edible oils in the local market, in order to help her children in her home. A challenge she faces is the rainy season. She started this business with a little money from her mother. She says handling her own money makes her happy about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil to sell, at her business. She wants to expand her business and own a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil to sell, at her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville South, Liberia with her four children ages 11 to 26.  The children live at home and three of them attend school.  She is married to a local businessman. 

Theresa has been in the red (palm) oil business for eight years now.  She makes sales from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours each day on her business.  Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business.  She hopes to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more red (palm) oil for her business.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is a young farmer from Khndzoresk village, in Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, one-year-old daughter, and grandmother. To be able to take care of his family, Mher is engaged in breeding cattle and other livestock, including sheep and pigs. Farming is the only source of income for the family. Mher realizes income from the agricultural products, in the local market. His wife helps him in his everyday activities concerning farming.

To continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Mher needs to make some investments in it. The new investments will make it more productive. A loan of USD 3,000 will support him greatly, enabling him to purchase two cows, six pigs, and some forage for the livestock. The loan will help Mher maintain and develop his agribusiness. He and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, six pigs, and some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married and has four children. She has received some schooling, until the end of junior high school. Currently, Comfort extracts palm oil for sale, at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this industry for about five years, now. Her husband is a carpenter. Comfort’s income goes towards helping her husband to pay for the family's general expenses.

Comfort will use the loan to increase her existing palm fruit inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Comfort plans to develop her business further, by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing palm fruit inventory

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 50-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling fruit for the past 10 years. She is very enthusiastic about her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of seven children and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas. This will help her to meet the market demand consistently. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 26 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business, selling goats. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Recently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000, which she used to purchase two more goats. She is in her seventh loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: At the age of 50, Zahida is a married woman and a mother of six children. She is actively involved in her business stitching clothes that she began a year ago. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more clothes on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Annastasiah

texts.en: Annastasiah lives in the northern coastal town of Malindi, in Kenya. She is 28 years old, and she is a married business lady. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past two years, and the business has been growing since then. She wants to move the business to the next level. She wants to buy ten bales of second-hand clothes for the business. She knew about Milango through friends who invited her, and she decided to join in. The challenge that she faces is the low season. She will use the income that she will earn, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ten bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old. She lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She and her fiancée, who is a local businessman, live together. Together, they have a three-year-old child, who is currently in school and lives at home.

For the past five years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto está casado con la Sra. Julia tienen 2 hijos menores que están en la primaria, sus dos hijos son el motivo de lucha de esta pareja, ya que quieren poder darles todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna.        
 Ellos tienen un pequeño local de costura donde confeccionan uniformes para empresas y varios tipos de ropa para la venta. Ernesto trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, y comenta que se inició en la actividad con un dinero  que junto de  otros trabajos anteriores.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas al por mayor, ya que así podrá tener un margen de ganancia para poder seguir trabajando y luchando por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married to Señora Julia.  They have two young children who are in elementary school.  Their two children are the reason this couple struggles, because they want to be able to give them everything they need to have a respectable life.

They have a small sewing shop where they sew company uniforms and various types of clothing to sell.  Ernesto works together with his wife and says that he began this business with money that he gathered from other, previous jobs.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the wholesale purchase of cloth, because in this way he will be able to have an earnings margin so he can keep working and struggling for his children.

loans.use: to buy cloth for sewing in bulk.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is 28 years old and lives in Paynesville South; she is single and lives alone. She completed 12th grade, before joining into business.  She describes herself as a skillful woman. She explains how she has been plaiting and dressing hair, from a booth that is situated along the street. She provides for herself with this business.  She has been operating this booth for five years, now. She started this business by plaiting some young women's hair in her community. She made lots of money from that, which enabled her to open a booth and have more customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase some hair products, such as grease, artificial hair, shampoo, and hair conditioner, for her business. Her plans are to build a salon and a clinic.

loans.use: to purchase some hair products for her business, such as artificial hair, shampoo, and hair conditioner

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevas Amigas está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven en los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima variado pero por lo general es de clima frió, su geografía accidentada le regala hermoso paisajes en donde se disfruta de la naturaleza, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre 1999. Su gente y sus tradiciones hacen de esta ciudad una ciudad cálida. Las socias  son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Natividad, forma parte del grupo de crédito Nuevas Amigas y está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas, con quienes tiene una muy buena amistad y un mismo objetivo el cual es salir adelante con todas sus compañeras.
La Señora María Natividad tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos mayores de edad, seis de ellos viven independientes, solo una de sus hijas casadas viven en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es propiedad de sus padres.
Doña María Natividad labora en la tareas del campo que su padre le inculco, cría ganado, cuyes, cerdos y borregos que vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura que es más para el consumo de su hogar pero si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, cerdos y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener más animales de mejor calidad.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevas Amigas is made up of 11 women who live around the city of Cuenca. This city has a varied climate but generally it's cold. Its rugged geography endows it with beautiful landscapes where one can enjoy the nature. It is a World Heritage Site since December 1999. Its people and its traditions makes this city very warm. 

The members of Nuevas Amigas are hard-working and enterprising, one of them is María Natividad. This is her first loan together with her friends with whom she shares a very good friendship and a common goal of moving forward together as a group.

María Natividad is 56 years old, married, and the mother of seven adult children whereof six are independent. Only one daughter lives in her parents' house, she is married to a bricklayer and they share the household expenses. 

María Natividad works with farming, which she learned from her father. She raises cattle, guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep and sells them in her community. She also works with agriculture, the main part going to the family's own consumption but if there is a surplus she sells it. She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and animal feed. Her goal is to have more animals of better quality. The small photo is of a member who couldn't join them when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: El Batán  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Batan está formado por 7 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes viven por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, es cuna de grandes deportistas, poetas y artesanos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres, todas las socias tiene una meta y objetivo en común la cual es mejorar su económica y superación familiar.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Carmen, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito El Batan, le gusta este grupo debido a que todas tienen un mismo objetivo en común el cual es la dedicación por su familia para salir en adelante.
La Señora. Carmen tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 17, 11 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio, su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Carmen se dedica a laborar como auxiliar de limpieza desde hace algunos años, labora de lunes a sábados todo el día, también lava ropa ajena, estas actividades le permiten mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para pollos para iniciar con esta actividad. Su meta es tener su propio negocio como una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The group El Batan is comprised of 7 women and 2 men that live near the center of the city of Cuenca, an area that is known for its chilly climate, its many athletes, poets, and craftsmen, and since December of 1999 has been considered the Cultural Heritage Center of Humanity.  The people care for the culture and traditions taught to them by their ancestors.  Each person shares the common goal of improving their economic situation and getting ahead.

One of the members of this group is named Carmen.  She is seeking her second loan, along with her friends and group members.  She likes belonging to this group because each member has the same objective, which is a dedication to helping their families get by.

Carmen is 42 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children that are 17, 11, and 2 years old.  Her oldest son is studying in college.  Her second child, a daughter, studies in the public school.  They don't own their own home, but instead rent.

For many years Carmen has worked in cleaning. She works from Monday to Saturday, all day long.  She also does laundry for extra income.  These jobs help her support her family and household.

This loan will be used to buy chickens and chicken food.  She wants to start raising chickens because her goal is to one day have her own business, such as a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Rosas Rojas esta formado por 7 mujeres que viven en el cantón de Paute, este cantón tiene un clima privilegiado por su clima templado, sus tierras son fértiles ya que se cosechan las más hermosas flores, existe una gran variedad de frutas y cuenta con paisajes hermosos por su geografía accidentada. Las socias son personas amables, gentiles que gozan de muy buena salud, siempre mantienen su buen humor y una sonrisa en su rostro, trabajan a diario para mejora la estabilidad económica de sus hogares para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Fanny, se encuentra 3 años en el grupo de crédito Rosas Rojas, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque le dan la oportunidad de establecer mayores lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras y a su vez salir adelante con su familia.
La Señora Fanny tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años que está estudiando en una escuelita del sector, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Fanny cría cuyes y pollos, también labora en tareas del campo solo cuando le llaman y eso es de 2 o 3 días a la semana. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y  alimento para animales. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The borrower group Rosas Rojas includes 7 women who live in the canton of Paute. This canton is privileged to enjoy a temporate climate, and fertile lands where the most beautiful flowers and a grand variety of fruits are harvested. Its rugged geography gives rise to lovely landscapes.

The group members are kind, gentle people who enjoy very good health, and always keep their good humor and a smile on their face. They work daily to improve the economic stability of their homes to provide a better future for their children.

One of the members is Fanny, who has been part of the group Rosas Rojas for three years. She likes this form of credit because it gives her the opportunity to establish stronger bonds of friendship with all of her group members while improving the conditions of her family. Fanny is 35 years old and is a single mother with a 6-year-old daughter who is studying in a school in the sector. She lives in her own house. Fanny raises guinea pigs and chickens and also performs fieldwork when called upon, and that happens about 2-3 days per week. She will invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed. Her goal is to continue growing her business and provide a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Mabinty A

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Mabinty.  She is married and has three children, aged 13, 11 and 6 years. In 1994, Mabinty established her personal care products business. She began her business, because she got married at an early age.  At that time, her husband's elder sister was a trader, and Mabinty usually assisted her in the market. She and her sister-in-law traded from one place to another.  Years later (in 1994), she started her own petty trading, which she has continued until now.  She had good experience, which has helped her a lot over the years.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,798,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Mabinty requires a loan, in order to purchase cartons of hair products and body lotion. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business and develop her vacant land. Competition is her major challenge.  She is grateful for being given the opportunity to access this loan from ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of hair products and body lotion

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the highland area of Kericho, where tea is mostly grown. She loves farming and has been doing it for four years. She is involved in dairy and tea farming, which is her primary income base. She states that farming is very expensive. She chose Juhudi Kilimo, because it caters to the needs of small-scale farmers. When asked what she learned from Juhudi's Microfinance training, she said, "Savings is key to every farmer who wants to grow."

This loan will benefit Caroline by enabling her to purchase poultry birds. The birds will produce eggs for selling, increasing her profit and thus improving her living standard. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo, for the help it has accorded to her.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristian está casado con la señora Andrea son recién casados aun no tienen hijos, son una pareja muy enamorada, que lucha por una vida digna.
Cristian trabaja en un transporte alternativo; tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo. Además de su trabajo, su esposa trabaja como vendedora  de Artículos de primera necesidad que trae de la Argentina y del Brasil  para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando están ampliando para su casa, y comprando las comodidades de su hogar
El pide de este crédito para poder comprarle a su esposa los artículos de primera necesidad que vende, y de esa forma poder ayudarle. Quiere comprarle verduras, golosinas, frutas, bebidas, y demás para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Cristian is married to Andrea. They are recently married and have no children. They are a couple who are very in love, and who struggle for a dignified life.

Cristian works in alternative transport; he has his own vehicle which he made a great effort to purchase. In addition to his work, his wife works as a vendor of basic commodities which she imports from Argentina and Brazil to help her husband with the household expenses. Thanks to the work they are carrying out, they are enlarging their house and increasing the comfort of their home. 

Cristian is requesting the loan so his wife can buy the basic commodities that she sells. He wants to buy her vegetables, sweets, fruits, drinks and other products so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sweets, fruits, drinks and other products

loans.name: San Antonio B Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio B  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Florencia es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de pescados, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo viene mejorando su vida. Está luchando por salir adelante y mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de pescados variados, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, y seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
This group is called San Antonio B and it is in its first loan cycle. This group is from the city of Concepción, in an area near the city center, which is rapidly growing.  It is a difficult area to access, and for this reason the people in the group want to support the growth and provide the area with a better environment so that it will continue to grow into the future.

Florencia is one of the members of this group.  She sells fish and she sells them in other areas around the city as well.  She is a hard-working person that, with a lot of work and strength, has improved her life. She struggles to get ahead and to improve the livelihood of her family.

She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of various fish so that she can continue selling them.  She wants to provide her customers with a great selection of fish.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville South.  She is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband is a local businessman. They have three children who live at home and attend school. 

Ruth sells dried fish, which she delivers to her customers. Her main difficulty is unexpected fluctuations in the level of business. Ruth learned this business from her mother. She is proud to run her own business, as it gives her independence. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish to resell. In the future, she wants to further her own education and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Hala Group

texts.en:
Ibtissam is the featured borrower of Hala's group. She joined together with the other group members, to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Ibtissam is a 53-year-old widow and mother of two children. She is sacrificing her whole life for the sake of providing them with the best standard of living. Ibtissam works as a housekeeper. She provides cleaning services to several homes and offices, which has been her only source for living since her husband passed away. She works hard to increase her income, in order to provide her children with the things they need and request.

Ibtissam is acquiring a portion of this loan, in order to start a new business of her own to improve her family's living. She will start selling clothes from her house. She will also work on visiting expected customers, to distribute her products easily.

As for the future, she hopes that one day she'll be capable of opening her own clothes-selling shop and able to quit providing cleaning services to strangers. Ibtissam is the lady with the green top, at the right side of the image, Hanan is at the center, wearing black, and Rimonda is the lady at the left side.

loans.use: To start a new business of her own, to improve her family's living

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ibrahim, a married father of two children aged eight and five years. In 1996, Ibrahim established his used-clothing business with capital he accrued from farming.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 608,000 every month.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more bales of jeans and polo shirts. One of his challenges is that some bales of clothing will not be of high quality. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to provide quality education for his children and expand the business. He is a hardworking man who thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more jeans and t-shirts

loans.name: Haruna  M

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Haruna. He is married, and has two children aged 6 years and 9 months. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him and assists in his business.  

In 2010, Haruna established a business selling provisions and drinks. He began his business because he is a graduate but didn't have a job. His father gave him some money to start a business. Working 16 hours a day, seven days a week, he earns about 1,050,000 SLL every month from his business. 

Haruna is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Haruna requires a loan in order to buy cartons of Peak milk, biscuits, and soft drinks. In the future, Haruna plans to open another outlet, to complete his building project, to become an international businessman and to educate his children. 

Inadequate electricity sometimes is a challenge in his business. He is a hardworking man, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of Peak milk, biscuits, and drinks.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is an experienced farmer from Goris city of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and son. With the help of her family members she is engaged in breeding livestock--cows and piglets. Karine's husband and son help her take the agricultural products to the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. As the family's needs are growing day by day, Karine needs to expand her agribusiness to more effectively take care of the family. She needs a loan of USD 750 to purchase three calves. The loan will help her sustain and develop her agribusiness. Karine and her family members will highly appreciate the lenders' support and will be grateful to them for the goodwill in helping her collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeni vive en la ciudad de Camana, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de pesado, negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, Yeny trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; Yeny cree que le va viene en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad.

Yeny esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y algunos implementos y herramientas  como mandiles, cuchillos, tablas, entre otros, así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder tener un mejor local y un frigorífico”.
texts.en:
Yeni lives in the city of Camana, and works in her small business buying and selling fish. This business is her only source of income for settling her household expenses. Yeny works around 10 hours a day and can assist up to 20 customers each day; Yeny believes that her business is going well because she treats her customers kindly and above all because she offers fresh and high-quality products.

Yeny is grateful to the lenders of Kiva because thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business and some implements and tools such as aprons, knives, boards, among others, so she can better serve her customers and be able to achieve her dream: "To have a better locale and a refrigerator."

loans.use: to buy merchandise, implements and tools for her business

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is an experienced farmer from Bagravan village of Shirak region. He lives with his wife, school-age son and his mother. To take care of his family, Gevorg is extensively engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding a livestock of piglets and hens and in beekeeping. His wife assists him in his every day activities related to farming.

Gevorg sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the most important source of income for the family.  As the autumn is progressing, Gevorg's agribusiness needs some investments. A loan of $3000 USD will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family.  The loan will enable Gevorg to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, to buy fertilizer, to buy some forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services. Gevorg and his family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful for the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, to buy fertilizer, to buy some forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Jayanca, trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi, y este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante y  sacar adelante a su familia, Jose cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy trabajador y siempre tiene fe en Dios.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamitas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá completar el dinero para poder comprar otra mototaxi, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa de transportes”.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the city of Jayanca. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver, and this job is the only source of income to get ahead and raise his family. Jose believes he is moving forward because he is very hard working and he always has faith in God.

Jose is grateful for the kiva microlenders and he thanks them for the help they have provided him to be able to buy another motorcycle taxi, so he can improve his income and continue to fight to realize his big dream: "To have a transport company."

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and lives in Paynesville South. She is a widow. She has three children aged between 18 and 50, one of whom lives at home and attends school. 

Esther sells fish from a table in her local market. Her main difficulty is keeping the business going when school fees and other expenses use up all of her cash. She learned this business from her mother, and she is proud to run her own business. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future, she wants to buy a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Kasaali Kwewayo Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Kyotera town, Rakai district. It is comprised of six members, three ladies and three men.

Justine, one of the group's members, is a married woman, aged thirty years. She is the mother of two children, aged six and ten years, who both go to school. She does outside catering, as her main source of income. She trades firewood, as a supplementary business. In catering, she works six days a week, for only seven hours a day. Justine started the business in 2010, because she lacked formal employment. Her customers come from Bikira Health Centre, or are passers-by. The challenge with her business is the rainy season, when customer turnout is low.

She is going to use the loan to buy a stock of foods, such as Irish potatoes and rice, and utensils, i.e., warmers for keeping the food hot. Her dream is to buy herself a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy food and utensils for her catering business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a young farmer from Akhuryan village of Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two little sons (1 and 3 years old). To meet his family's daily needs, Ruben is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat and apple. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the only source of the family's income. 

To continue running it in a sustainable way, Ruben needs a loan of $2000 USD to purchase some forage (grass and barley) for the cattle, pigs and piglets, and to make previous credit repayments. With the help of the loan Ruben will maintain and develop his agribusiness further. He and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful for their support of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase some forage (grass and barley) for the cattle, pigs and piglets, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Sorbeh Teko Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Sorbeh Teko” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each, in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Aminata is a 33-year-old, married woman, who has four children. Three of the children are attending primary and secondary schools. Aminata sells fish, a business in which she has been engaged for four years. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Campo 9 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, en el cual están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Natividad, quien se dedica a la venta variada de prendas y perfumes, comenta que tiene buena clientela que siempre le hace pedidos, y es con eso que está pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder crecer y mejorar su vida.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar prendas y perfumes variados, ya que de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y podrá ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is in its third cycle.  The women form part of the program for eradicating poverty, and are taking the poverty eradication survey to distinguish their individual circumstances.  One of the members is Natividad, who sells clothing and perfume.  She says that she has a good clientele that always orders from her, and this is allowing her to get ahead and to help her family.  She is a very hardworking person who strives to grow and improve her life.  Natividad is requesting this loan in order to buy an assortment of clothes and perfumes, which will allow her to continue her sales and offer her clients variety.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point. She is 27 years old and married with two children, 6 and 12 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For four years now, she has been selling sugar, milk, oats, etc. in the local market. She sells charcoal for one of her friends. This is where she got some money to start this business. She learned this way from her best friends, and she likes her business because she generates some money every time she sells. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, milk, oats, etc. for her business. Her dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, oats, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy trabajador, ha logrado estudiar la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas y gracias a ello trabaja en el municipio de su ciudad, Juan trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y ordenado.

Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá viajar para poder realizar unos trámites documentarios, así podrá tener sus documentos en regla para trabajar y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa de Informática”.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking young person. He has studied systems engineering and thanks to that he works in the city. Juan works around 8 hours a day and believes that it is going well for him at work because he is responsible and organized. 

Juan is thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have given him, he will be able to travel in order to do some paperwork processing. In that way, he will be able to have his documents in order so that he can work and continue fighting to be able to make his big dream a reality: have an information technology company.

loans.use: to be able to do paperwork processing.

loans.name: San Cayetano 3 Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano 3 es un grupo muy trabajador, que con muchas ganas de salir adelante se ha unido. Ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder ayudar a sus familias  y mejorar sus vidas.
Una persona trabajadora y digna de destacar es Elsa, quien vende perfumes, colonias y esencias de perfumes, tiene muy buena clientela, en especial mujeres, además siempre esta con muy buena variedad, es por eso que le va muy bien. Se unió al grupo para poder dar a su familia una pequeña ayuda por medio de su trabajo e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes variados, así seguirá con sus ventas y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
San Cayetano 3 is a hard working group. A strong desire to get ahead has united them together. They are part of the poverty elimination program, as a means to support their families and improve their lives.
One hardworking and noteworthy person is Elsa, who sells perfumes, colognes and perfume essences. She has very good clientele, especially women. She always has a very good variety, which is why she's doing very well. She organized the group in order to give her family a little help through her work and keep improving their situation of poverty.
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various fragrances and continue with her sales and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes to sell

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri city of Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two school-age daughters (8 and 10 years old). To be able to take care of his family's needs, Arshak runs a local store where he sells heating systems that are sent by his brother from Europe. He also provides different services related to installation of those systems. 

The assortment of items that Arshak sells is not very big and needs to be expanded in order for his small business to function productively. He needs a loan of $3000 USD to purchase new items to sell in the store. The loan will help him maintain and develop his small business further. Arshak and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and are thankful for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in his store

loans.name: Kuña Aty El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty El Triunfo está en su ciclo número  4to. del programa de comité, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por superar su pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles variados, comenta que a su clientela le agrada mucho las comidas que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Ella es una persona muy hábil en lo que hace, y es gracias a eso que día a día mejora, también recibe capacitaciones de como poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Aty El Triunfo" is in its 4th cycle of the committee's program. They form part of the program of poverty elimination, where all of them are putting forth their greatest effort to overcome their poverty. 

One of the members is Graciela, who works in the sale of a variety of groceries. She comments that her customers really like the food that she makes, and it is for that reason that it is going well for her. She is a person who is very skillful in what she does, and it is thanks to that, that day by day she gets better. She also receives trainings of how to be able to improve. 

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue making food, including meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and more. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving, since it will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and more.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 29 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She did attend school. She is married and has three children, whose ages are between 8 and 11. Her husband is a businessman, and her children attend school. Mamie has been involved in the apple business for the past two years. She enjoys her business, because she makes a lot of profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase five boxes of apples for her business. She plans to educate her children and build a house, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of apples for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow and has six children. Only three children attend school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past 20 years she has been running a table where she sells fish.  She sells fish six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.  

She likes her business because of the customers that buy from her, and because she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She always uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 43 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend and has two children. She did not go to school due to financial problem. Her children are 6 and 8 years old and they are currently in school. Her partner is a seller of scratch cards. 

Albertine has had a business selling soft drinks for four years. Some days the business is good and other days it is very slow. She started this business by selling water and bread. Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  Albertine has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell. In the future she hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está empezando a trabajar, ya que está en su ciclo uno, están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para salir de la línea de pobreza. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero debe seguir trabajando y esforzándose. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa quiere mejorar  su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Ella vende comestibles, y es de esa forma humilde que está tratando de salir adelante y dar a su familia lo mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar su vida y su situación económica.
texts.en:
This group is starting to work, since it is in its first cycle. They are forming part of the program of poverty elimination, where every one of them puts forth their best effort in order to leave the poverty line.

One of the members is Rosa, who in her survey showed a level of poverty inside of level one. This is to say that she has very low income, but she should continue working and putting forth effort. Through effort and continuous work and the application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman, she wants to improve her situation of poverty, but she is equally conscious of the fact that this work and effort that she is making should be continuous and permanent. 

She sells food, and it is in this humble way that she is trying to move forward and give the best to her family. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue making the food that she sells, and in that way continue working to improve her life and economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Action Group Teko

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Action Group Teko” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mamawa is the featured leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mamawa has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, pepper, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Carmen esta trabajando hace once ciclos juntas, son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, y quieren ir mejorando su vida y sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ylda, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos, y debe seguir esforzándose, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de empanadas está tratando de salir adelante.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder comprar un congelador para guardar sus productos cárnicos y hortícolas los cuales usa para hacer sus empanadas, ya que el clima es muy caluroso y quiere mantenerlos frescos.  Está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen del Carmen" has been working together for eleven cycles. They are women heads of the family who are fighting to give their families everything that they could not have. They form part of the program of poverty elimination, and they want to improve their life and income. 

One of the members is Ylda, who in her survey showed a poverty level inside level one, which is to say with low income, and she should continue putting forth effort. Through her effort and continuous work, and through the sale of empanadas she is trying to move forward. 

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy a freezer to save her meat products and vegetables that she uses to make empanadas, since the climate is very hot and she wants to keep them fresh. She is happy for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to maintain her supplies fresh for making food.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a farmer from Haykadzor village of Shirak region. He lives with his wife, daughter, two sons and daughter-in-law. To take care of his family’s needs Davit is extensively engaged in agribusiness. He is involved in cattle breeding, in breeding a livestock of sheep, in aviculture (birds), in beekeeping and in cultivation of wheat. Davit’s sons help him in selling the agricultural products in the local market. 

To be able to run his agribusiness in a more efficient way, Davit needs a loan of $3000 USD to purchase agricultural machinery. With the help of the machinery it will be easier for him and for his family members to organize their agribusiness. As this is Davit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Davit and his family are thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery

loans.name: Euphemia

texts.en:
Euphemia is 28 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is unmarried and has a 9-year-old child living with her and attending school. 

For three years now, she has been selling charcoal by the bag in the local market. She sells during morning hours and afternoon hours, from Monday to Saturday. She gives goods on credit to some customers and collects the money later; most interestingly, she makes her own money. Euphemia has requested a loan to purchase 40 more bags of charcoal for her business. 

In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase 40 more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses lives in the north coastal town of Malindi. He is 25 years old and he is married. He runs a clothes business in town that has existed for more than five years. He also owns a beauty salon that earns him extra income. He has ambitions that some day he will run a successful boutique in Malindi. He knew about Milango through friends and now he is seeking a loan to buy bedsheets to add to his current stock. The challenges that he has to endure in the business include competition and the low season. He is newly married and wishes to secure his future. The income that he will raise from the business will secure his future.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 30-year-old single businessman. He runs a photography business that has been in operation for the last seven years. He knew about Milango through friends and now he is seeking a loan to buy a printer. He has an ambition to expand his business in the next five years to be able to increase his income. The challenges that he faces in business are clients not paying their debts on time and competition from other businesses. He will use the income raised from the business to pay a dowry as he plans to get married.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old, married to Cleopas, and she supports five members of her family. 

She has been in the poultry farming business for the last  three years, earning a monthly income of KSH 10,000. She operates her business in Kapsabet, Kenya, and she is served by Kadet Kapsabet office. 

She will use the loan of  KSH 20,000  to purchase poultry feed. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to improve production on the farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 31 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has four children between the ages of 5 and 21. Her children are attending school and living at home.  She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

Over the past nine years, she has been cooking and selling rice and soup from a local restaurant. She spends 14 hours each day on her business. She likes her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. She started this business with money given to her by mother; she uses a taxi most of the time to buy the food ingredients.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, meat, pepper, coal, Vita, plates, etc. for her business. 

She plans to build a house and become a big businesswoman.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders whose are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, pepper, coal, Vita, plates, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35-year-old man living with wife and four children, who all go to school. He is involved in cattle fattening and trade,  which he has been doing for over thirty years.

According to him, through his business, he has been able to provide everything for his family. Alongside cattle fattening and trade, Joseph is involved in farming which contributes to his sources of income.

Joseph says he has been able to educate his children and provide other essential necessities for his family. Joseph is accessing a loan to boost his cattle fattening business and farming and he says he is going to buy cows.

Joseph says his customers are cattle traders from his home area. According to him, his biggest challenge is cattle diseases such as foot and mouth, and insufficient  capital to run a cattle trade business. 

He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strengths. Finally he appreciates the work done by ugafode through advancing him credit and allowing him to pay on a quarterly basis.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Las Lambareñas Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Lambareñas inician el segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, están luchando por poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
 Cynthia es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles variados, y es por medio de su trabajo y los ricos comestibles que hace que le está yendo muy bien. Ella sueña con poder tener una tienda de comidas y así tener un lugar donde ofrecer sus comidas a sus clientes.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en insumos para hacer sus comestibles, y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Las Lambareñas communal bank is starting its second cycle with the women’s committee program.  They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial.  They are struggling in order to be able to help their families by all working together.

Cynthia is part of this group.  She sells varied food.  It is because of this work and the delicious food that she makes that it is going very well for her.  She dreams of being able to have a food store.  This way she would have a place to sell her food to her customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy supplies to make her food.  This way she will be able to continue helping her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her food to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 55 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Joseph, who is a retired civil servant, and they are blessed with two children ages 28 and 15.

Gladys is a shopkeeper.  She has been running this business for the last 20 years. She has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd.  The loan of 50,000 KES will enable her to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, rice, cooking fat, salt and detergent.

Gladys earns a monthly income of 26,000 KES from her business.  Her intention is to use profits from her expanded business to add more stock to her shop and to educate one of her children who is still in school.

Her hopes and dreams for her future are to open a supermarket and for her family to be financially stable.

loans.use: To stock her general store with items such as flour, rice, sugar, cooking fat, salt and detergent

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education,  Joyce is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit, such as oranges and food stuffs, such as plantain and cassava in Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years.  

Joyce  is married and has 7 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Joyce wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of oranges. 

In the long term, Joyce plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old, married to Mark, and she supports two members of her family. She has been in the boutique business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KSH 10,000. She operates her business in Kapsabet and is served by Kadet Kapsabet office. 

She has borrowed KSH 30,000 to purchase new clothes, shoes and sandals, among other items, that her clients demand. She will use the profits from the business to establish other enterprises.

loans.use: to expand her boutique business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kongowea, which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 31-year-old single mother of one. She sells clothes at the local market and she has been in this business for the last three years. The business has grown over the years and she has been able to employ someone to help her run the business. 

She knew about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more bales of clothes for sale. This business is the sole income earner for her and she strives to make it succeed. She hopes that the business will grow to big enough to earn her more income in the next five years. 

The major challenges that she faces in the business include competition and financing. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living and also educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarash is 35 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 22. Her children are in school and live at home with her in the West Point area, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado County, which produces fish for the Liberian local market. 

She has been running a restaurant in the local market over the past year. She uses a taxi most of the time to buy her food ingredients and she faces problems during the rainy season because she does not have a good location in the local market. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to increase her customer traffic by buying more rice, oil, fish, meat, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. for her business. 

Her dream is to build a house for her children. She is happy with her business because she makes enough money most of the time.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mercedes vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja en su pequeño de farmacia, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para salir adelante, y poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 4 y 12 años; Mercedes cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los cliente sy ofrece productos de buena calidad.

Marcedes esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más medicina para su negocio, de esta manera poder atender as sus clientes de mejor manera y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in the city of Pucallpa. She works in her small pharmacy, which allows her to be able to have income to move forward, and to be able to move her two children forward (they are 4 and 12 years old). Mercedes believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is very friendly with her customers and offers products of good quality. 

Mercedes is thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have given her, she will be able to buy more medicine for her business. In this way she will be able to attend to her customers in a better way, and be able to improve her income. In that way, she will continue fighting to make her big dream a reality: give a profession to her children.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in Uganda. He is married and has eight children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and increase his income. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wholesale shop. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his stock

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja, 42, resides with her husband and three children in West Point. Her children are between the ages of 6 and 17, and are attending school. Her husband is a businessman, and Haja received the initial capital from her husband to start this business. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling gas and fuel/oil. She loves this business because she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business and she contributes to her family's expenses. 

She is requesting her fifth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business.

Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is an old man of forty five years, living with his wife and seven children, six of whom are attending school. He is a business man, with a milling machine in his village, an activity he has done for three years.

Alongside using his milling machine for cereals, Fred runs a produce business which supplements his daily income. In addition to this, Fred is involved in agriculture and through this, he has been able to supplement his income and provide food at home, so he is able to take care of his family. 

Fred says he has acquired this loan facility to boost his milling machine business and produce business as he wants to buy another machine to help him expedite his work.

Fred also says that his biggest clientele base is local people who bring maize for milling. According to him, his biggest challenge is limited capital and weather changes such as droughts and floods. He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything by his own efforts.

loans.use: To buy a new milling machine

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 36 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 22. Three of her kids are going to school and live at home. She did not attend school, but she is a businesswoman who manages her business well. Her husband is businessman. 

She manages her business well to enable her to support her home. Over the past two years, she has been running a local restaurant in the local market, without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her husband. She sells six days a week, spending ten hours each day with her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, meat, rice, oil, Vita, pepper, etc. for her business.

 Her plan is to expand her business even more. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, oil, Vita, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.es:
Jean vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, para poder tener ingresos y salir adelante trabaja como asistente en una pequeña empresa de obras de construcción, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas, ya que depende del tamaño e construcción que se realice, Jean cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy colaborador y le gusta aprender cosas nuevas.

Jean está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar una moto con la cual podrá movilizarse ya que su trabajo queda en una zona muy alejada y gasta mucho dinero en pasajes, así podrá ahorrar y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad  su gran sueño:” Tener su propia empresa constructora”.
texts.en:
Jean lives in the city of Pucallpa.  In order to be able to get income and get ahead, he works as an assistant at a small construction company.  He works around ten hours, depending upon the size and construction that he is doing.  Jean believes that it is going well for him in his work because he is very collaborative, and he likes to learn new things.

Jean is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a motorcycle, which will allow him to get around.  His work is in an area that is very far away, and he wastes a lot of money on paying for transportation.  This way he will be able to save and continue struggling to be able to make his big dream come true.  His dream is to have his own construction company.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bibirahima

texts.ru: Бибирахима живет и работает на юге Таджикистана. Она введет здоровый образ жизни. Бибирахима работает 7-8 часов в день и работает 6 дней в недели. Она живет вместе с родителями, так как она еще не замужем и не имеет детей. Бибирахима 2 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей одежды на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает женскую одежду, так как спрос на женскую одежду больше чем на мужские или детские одежды на местном рынке. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих родителей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки женской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Она мечтает выйти замуж и родить прекрасных детей.
texts.en:
Bibirahima lives and works in southern Tajikistan. She maintains a healthy lifestyle. Bibirahima works seven to eight hours per day, six days per week. She lives with her parents, since she is not married and has no children. 

Two years ago, Bibirahima started her own business buying and selling clothes in the local market. She has a retail location in the local market. She mostly sells women's clothing, since the demand for women's clothes in the local market is higher than for men's or children's clothes. She needs to update her products for the new season and attract more customers, since she needs to earn more money to support her parents. 

She is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy women's clothing for the new season. She awaits your generosity and hopes for your charity. She dreams of getting married and having beautiful children.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for new season

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio está en su ciclo número  12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elsa, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su estilo de vida y la de su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene su taller de costura y por medio de las confecciones que hace ayuda a su familia teniendo los ingresos que necesita.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de tejidos, hilos, y todo tipo de insumos que ella necesita para cumplir con sus clientes; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Su objetivo es aumentar su la cantidad de máquinas y trabajadores a su cargo, tener mayor variedad y calidad para poder mantener su clientela y ganar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is on its twelfth round with the women's program, in which all the members work and support each other in pursuing their goals.  One of the members is Ms. Elsa, who thanks to non-stop effort and work and the determination of a successful woman, finds her and her family's lifestyle improving.  Among the work that keeps her occupied is her sewing shop.   The items she makes there help her family to earn the income they need.

Ms. Elsa is seeking this loan to buy fabric, thread, and various other materials she needs to supply her customers.  This will help her to shore up her business model, which will help her increase her earnings.  Her objective is to increase the number of machines and workers in her shop, and to produce a greater variety and quality of merchandise so as to keep the customers she has and attract new customers, as well.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 40 years old, married, and supports two members of her family. Her spouse, James, helps in fending for the family, too. 

She is into a poultry, bee keeping, and dairy farming business in the Milango location, and is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last three years; she gets an average monthly income of Kshs 20,000.

She plans to use the loan of Ksh.30,000 to purchase an egg incubator. 

Her dream is to educate her children and build a hatchery.

loans.use: to purchase an egg incubator

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old from Nyandarua and is married but has no children yet.

Peter has a farming business that he has been doing for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to boost his farm. Peter is optimistic that his farm will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertlizers.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab lives in Kongowea north of Mombasa Kenya. She is 58 years old and widowed with five children. All her children are adults now. She runs her own business which leases plastic chairs to event organizers. She has been in the business for the last nine years and the business is growing. She has been able to employ someone to help her run the business. She heard of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more plastic chairs. The challenge in this business is the competition from others that is stiff. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more plastic chairs.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja is 35 years old and lives at West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has two children ages 2 and 11. Her children are attending school and living at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. Over the past three years she has been running a shop where she sells slippers and ladies handbags in the local market, and spends 10 hours each day on her business. She likes her business because of the popularity she achieved every day. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and ladies handbags for her business. She plans is to build a house and become a big business woman.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and ladies handbags for her business.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a married man aged 45 years with 4 children all attending different schools in Rakai. He lives in rural area and he has a retail shop business and he also deals in cattle rearing as well as trading which he considers as his side income. He started the business in 1998.

He works 7 days in a week and 14 hours per day where he divides his time so that the two businesses run smoothly. He said that he started his business to improve on the standard of living of his family and to get tuition for his children.

He is acquiring this loan to add stock in his retail business to enable his customer’s access all the items they want. His clients are residents of around his home for the retail shop and traders from Kampala and Kyotera for the cattle business.

His dream is to develop up to the level of wholesale and be the leading supplier of cattle products in his area. He said that the challenges he faces are many people delaying to pay their debts and weather changes like too much drought where they move long distances looking for pasture for the cattle. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man and is grateful that lenders keep helping businessmen and farmers.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
Hector vive en la calida ciudad de Tarapoto, es un joven e carácter jovial y carismático. Cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como mecánico en una empresa de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su familia con ayuda de su esposa quien lo anima cada día, Hector cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso.

Hector está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y especialmente comprar enseres para su hogar y de esta manera mejorar su  calidad de vida, así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Hector lives in the tropical city of Tarapoto.  He is a jovial and charismatic young man.  Every day he puts in the effort to advance himself, working as a mechanic at a shop in his city.  With the fruits of his labor, he is able to provide for his family with the support of his wife, who inspires him every day.  Hector believes that he's good at what he does because he is responsible and careful. 

Hector is thankful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to improve his house, especially by buying basic household items, and improve his quality of life.  This way he will be able to go on fighting to achieve his big dream: "passing on a profession to his son and improving his quality of life."

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Tamaraneh Freetown Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tamaraneh Freetown” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. 

With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Timarie is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a plumber and they have two children, one of whom is attending primary school and the other is not yet of school-going age. 

Timarie has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells various types of drinks including water, ginger beer, soft drinks, etc. 

With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of drinks to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of drinks to add to her current stock

loans.name: Gyulvard

texts.en:
Gyulvard is a farmer from Amasia village of Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband and eldest son work in the private sector, and her youngest son works in a rescuing service. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford their living expenses based on those salaries alone.  

To help her family in earning meet their living expenses, Gyulvard is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding a livestock of sheep, in aviculture (birds), and in cultivation of wheat and barley. Her husband and sons sell the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is an important source of the family's income. To sustain her agribusiness Gyulvard needs a loan of $3000 USD to purchase forage for the livestock (barley, grass, and sawdust), and to buy some fertilizer.  

As this is Gyulvard’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock (barley, grass, and sawdust) and to buy some fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Paul who produces additional income to the family, and they are blessed with three children aged 9, 9 and 7 years old.
