She owns a cosmetic and M-pesa shop, a business she has been running for the last three years. Margaret has applied for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 to be used for buying cosmetics to sell to her customers.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 18,000 and she intends to use profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her children, pay back her loan to Kadet Ltd and to expand her business further.

She has hopes and dreams of opening a very big cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to add more stocks of cosmetics so as to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old, married, and blessed with four children who are in school.

She is in farming business in Naivasha which she has practised for many years. She has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to own a bigger land which will enable her increase farm output.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old, from Nyandarua, and married. Together with her husband she has four children who are aged between 11 years and 1 year old.

Irene has a farming business that she has been running for four years now. She has applied for her fifth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her buy a cow. 

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 29 years old, widowed, and she is mother of three children who are in school.

She is in the farming business in Naivasha which she has practiced for five years. She has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to be among the top farmers in her area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 38 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married. Together they have five children who are aged between 22 years and 6 years old.

Agnes has a farming business that she has been running for many years and has applied for her fifth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in her farm.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old, from Engineer, married and blessed with three children who are aged between 3 years and 5 years old. 

Peter has a farming business that he has been running for the past year. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy sheep to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to be the leading farmer in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sheep to add to his stock.

loans.name: Abrose

texts.en: Abrose is 30 years old and supports six members of his family. He runs a retail shop in Chepkuny trading centre at the outskirts of Kapsabet town. He has been in the retail business for the last three years. He gets an average monthly income of Kshs 3,000. He plans to use the loan amount borrowed of Ksh. 90,000 to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en: Uba is grateful that she was able to receive a loan from Kiva. The loan improved her business and her life as well. She wants to be collecting all the milk from her village and sell to people in town and this is why she is asking for another loan. The challenge that she faces in the business is the bad debts. She is happy that Milango gave her the opportunity to improve her work. She now seeks a loan to buy milk from her village and transport it to Malindi town and sell for profit. The income she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бахтыгуль 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей.  У Бахтыгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Бахтыгуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бахтыгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход Бахтыгуль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бахтыгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Бахтыгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 25 years old, is married, and is raising two children with her husband. Bakhtygul has a secondary education. 

As the main source of income for her family, Bakhtygul raises livestock. She started her business five years ago with the purchase of a cow for 15,000 somoni. Thanks to Bakhtygul's hard work, her farm now contains two cows and five sheep. Bakhtygul's monthly income is 10,000 somoni.  

In order to further expand her farm, Bakhtygul has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 130,000 somoni to purchase calves to raise and resell.  Bakhtygul plans to invest the income from the loan to further grow the number of domestic animals on her farm, and plans to accumulate funds to build a house.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a small-scale seamstress and also operate a provisions store at Bimponaso  (near Twifo Praso). She has had some formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a purchasing clerk. 

Agnes has been working as a seamstress and a provision seller for almost 4 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions in order to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of expanding her shop, which would allow her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 48 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in Uganda. She is a widow and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of maize flour and beans to sell, and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and increase her income. Hadija hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a second store. 

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hadija who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano tiene 32  años, está en pareja con la Sra. Ramona, tienen 2 hijos,  es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí. El es fletero, es decir, se dedica al transporte de todo tipo de cosas.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando por su familia, pues quiere que tengan todo lo que necesitan.
El pide este crédito para el mantenimiento de su camión, ya que con el hace los fletes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo para poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 32 years old. He is married to Ramona, and they have two children. He is from the city of Paraguarí. 

Feliciano is a truck driver; he earns his living transporting all kinds of things. He is a very hardworking person who does his best for his family because he wants them to have everything they need. 

He is requesting this loan to do maintenance on his truck, which he uses to haul cargo. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given so that he can continue to strive.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a sixty seven years old. She is a widow and a mother of one child. She operates a M-pesa and flower shop. She has been in this business for nine years and gets monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Jane's third loan with KADET LTD, she intends to use the loan to purchase flowers and Mpesa float. Her future hopes and dreams are to promote all areas of her life by being prosperous.

loans.use: to buy flowers for sale and add M-pesa float.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a man of  sixty one years. He is married to Angelina and Josephine, and he is a father of twelve children. He does bicycle repairs, and has been in this business for a period of fourty years. He gets a monthly income of thirteen thousand five hundred shillings. 

This will be George's first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase spare parts for the bicycle repairs like tires, rims, spokes and tubes. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and open a spare parts shop and educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle tire rims, tubes etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty eight year old woman. She is a single mother of three children. She operates a milk kiosk and also does dairy farming. She has been in this business for two years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty seven thousand four hundred shillings.

This will be Jane's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy new furniture for the milk kiosk. Her future hope and dream is to buy a plot and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the milk kiosk.

loans.name: Torky

texts.en: Torky is young who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to provide a good life for his family. He has been working in the business of phone accessories for 3 years. He has lots of time to dedicate to his business and many people prefer his business because he is honest and hard-working. He has many ideas for his business that he’s been implementing little by little. He is a very dignified, confident man and his customers give him good references. Lately, he has been thinking about stocking his store with a bigger variety of products in order to attract more customers and fill demands. This idea was the impetus to request a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of products like phone accessories that would bring in customers. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for financing him in the first loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like phone accessories that would bring in customers.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 39-year-old single man, and a father of one child. He supports his parents and his son who is six years old. He supplies meat to butcheries and and has rental houses which earn him an income of twenty two thousand shillings monthly.

This will be Emmanuel's fourth loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to buy meat for supply and build one rental house. His future hope and dream is to educate his child to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase meat for sale and build one rental house.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 43 years old and married, with two daughters aged 14 and 7. He has operated a Zoona mobile money transfer business with his wife, Majory, for the past five years. 

Dominic’s previous two loans allowed him to increase his working capital so he could serve more customers. With his increased profit he was able to buy a fridge to keep the beverages he sells cold.  

Now, Dominic is applying for a third loan to be used to grow his business by opening another Zoona mobile money shop. He has found a location and will use the money to start serving customers. He is hopeful operating two outlets will increase his income further and improve his familiy's standard of living.

loans.use: to open a second Zoona mobile money transfer shop

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Ismail is a new client of UGAFODE and he applied for one million five hundred thousand shillings for buying fishing nets to use in his fishing business. He started the fishing business in the year 2000 and he says it has helped him get money to support his family. The business is located near the lake shore and his main clients are residents of Kasese District where he supplies the fish.

He hopes to get enough money from the business to pay school dues for his children and they will hence get quality education. His main challenge is the unpredictable fish season, since this causes price fluctuations and hence affects his income. He describes himself as a shrewd and honest businessman, which attributes have helped him carry on the business for this long.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a man of twenty four years. He is married to Veronica and a father of one child who is one month old. He lives in Ikinu in the outskirts of Kiambu. He operates a milk bar. He has been in this business for six years and gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings. 

This will be Simon's first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase more milk for sale and milk containers. His future hope and dream is to diversify to other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase milk and milk containers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a thirty-one-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of five children. She sells clothes in the town of Kiambu. Judith has been in this business for twelve years and earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

This will be Judith's fifth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes to sell. The profits will be used to pay school fees and reinvest in the business. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Manasses Harold

texts.es:
Manasses vive en el distrito de Santiago, el trabaja como albañil desde hace 4 años y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos del hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia, Manasses trabaja alrededor de 8 horas pero depende del tamaño de la construcción que realice; Manasses cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cuidadoso y responsable.

Manasses está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar 2 millares de ladrillo para poder construir una habitación de material noble para su vivienda y de esta manera poder apoyar a su hija y su nieto que debido a un accidente perdió su vivienda, asi podra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Ver feliz a su familia”.
texts.en: Manasses lives in Santiago District.  He has worked in construction for four years, and with the income from his job is able to cover his household expenses and help his family get ahead.  Manasses works about eight hours depending on the size of the construction project he's working on.  He thinks that he's doing well at work because he is very careful and responsible.  Manasses thanks Kiva lenders for their help with this loan which will allow him to buy two thousand bricks to build a room onto his house out of good material so he can support his daughter and grandson who lost their home in an accident.  He will be able to keep working to realize his dream of seeing his family happy.

loans.use: to buy bricks

loans.name: Leonidas Segundo

texts.es:
Leonidas vive en la ciduad de Carhuaz, desde hace 4 años tiene su negocio e venta de bebidas como cerveza, gaseosas, entre otros y con este negocio tiene una fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante; Leonidas le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo respetuoso.

Leonidas está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y así seguir luchando para salir adelante y hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Leonidas lives in the city of Carhuaz. He has had his business for four years; he sells drinks like beer, sodas, and more. This business provides him with a source of income to live on. Leonidas works in his business about ten hours a day, and he believes that it's going well for him because he is friendly and above all respectful to his customers. 

Leonidas is grateful to his Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business and continue striving to make a living and realize his dream of having a mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (beer).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and lives in West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has five children aged 6, 15, 17, 20, and 23, who are presently in school and living at home. She completed 9th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  

For the past two years Esther has been selling soft drinks and coal from a shop around the local market, and she sells six days a week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because it is a fast going business. She started this business by selling coal from her mother. She uses the bus to buy her stock.  

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and coal for her business. Her plan is to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders whose are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and coal for her business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 27 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children aged 7 and 13; they both live with her and are attending school. For two years she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market. She sells from morning to evening every day. Now she has a regular group of customers who buy from her, which makes her happy; making her own money also impresses her. 

Fatu has requested a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. In the future, she wants to own a house. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Bertha Petronila

texts.es: Bertha, tiene 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su esposo en el municipio de Villanueva. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años de venta de ropa como ser blusas, faldas, ropa interior, shorts, jeans, camisas, etc. el negocio lo tiene en casa. Ha solicitado un  prestamo por 4,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de ropa como blusas,vestidos,faldas, ropa interior, camisetas,jeans  etc.para la venta y asi podrá obtener mejores ganancias, ya que su inventario aumentara. Su meta es que su negocio crezca y poder tener su propio local con mercadería.
texts.en: Bertha, 27, has 2 children and is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband in the municipality of Villanueva.  She's had her own business for 4 years selling clothing such as: blouses, skirts, underwear, shorts, jeans, shirts, etc.  Her business is run from her home.  She has requested a loan for 4,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in clothing such as: blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, T-shirts, jeans, etc. to sell.  This way she can obtain more earnings because she will have more products to sell.  Bertha's goal is to grow her business and have her own store stocked with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell, including skirts, underwear, dresses, jeans, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia es de la ciudad d Encarnación, trabaja como  secretaria en un estudio jurídico. Actualmente cursa el tercer año de la carrera de derecho y cuenta que su aspiración es culminar su carrera y así seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos.
Quiere ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ser útil a los demás por medio de su conocimiento.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nathalia is from the city of Encarnación. She works as a secretary in a law office. She is currently in her third year of of a law degree program, and she says that her goal is to finish her degree and continue enriching her knowledge. She wants to be a successful professional whose knowledge can be of use to others. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can make her tuition payments, and therefore continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Lorine

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Lorine lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has six children between 20 and 31 years old. She was did not attend school.   

For the past nine years now Lorine has been operating a shop which sells charcoal in the local market. She spends ten hours each day on her business. She like her business because she has more customers and makes lots of profit, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time she uses the  bus to reach her goods at her shop.

Lorine is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build her own house and become an international businesswoman. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a tea farmer in Rwamugasha-Bushenyi in Uganda, and has been farming since 2005. He's applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to be able to buy fertilizers to put in the tea field so that the fertility of the soils can be boosted and lead to a better tea crop. In addition to tea farming, Charles has a butcher business which gives him additional income - income he uses to cater to the needs of the family. He works two days in the tea fields and attends to the butchery the rest of the week. 

Charles started the business in hopes of earning enough money to meet the needs of his family and is happy that the business has rewarded him. He has many hopes for his business, that it will grow and deliver large earnings. Charles is a hard working man who has often been challenged by the rainy season, which brings regular hail storms that damage the tea plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County, Liberia. She is 27 years old, single and has a four-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past three years she has been selling used clothes in her community market. She got money from her mother to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She wishes to one day buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is thirty-one years old. He is from Nakuru, Kenya. He is married to Susan, a farmer, and they are blessed with six children who are ages 1, 3, 5, 8, 10, and 12. 

George mainly specializes in growing maize and potatoes. He has been a farmer for the last ten years. Currently, his monthly income is Kshs.15,000. 

He is applying for a second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd. He will use the money to hire laborers to help him prepare his land for the next planting season and to buy seeds. The profits from his expanded business will be used to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot and build rental houses.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prepare his land for the next planting season and buy seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice from Liberia. She is 53 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She has five children, three of which live at home with her and attend school. 

Presently and for the past three years, Beatrice works selling cassava in the local market, by which she manages to make ends meet. She sells six days a week, ten hours a day. Sometimes sales are slow, but most of the time she makes a profit, which she uses to sustain her family. Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava for her business. She wishes in the near future to build a decent house. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava for her business.

loans.name: Jonnah

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Jonnah from Liberia. She lives near West Point, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. Jonnah is single and was able to complete 12th grade. For the past eight months now she has been operating a table selling palm oil in the local market. She spends ten hours a day, six days a week at her business. Jonnah started the business with financial help from her mother, and likes her business because she has good customers and makes a steady profit. Mostly she takes a taxi to get her products to her table. 

Jonnah is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to one day build her own house and become an international business woman. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Lovette A.

texts.en: Lovette A. is 24 years old and lives in the West Point area of Liberia, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a university student. Lovette A. has been selling use clothes for the past four years and she is a very successful business woman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her generate more profit. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business; she plans to build a house in the near future. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre is young Cameroonian, aged 27, not married and has no child. He has been in this business for over a year which has made him experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area which gives him many potential customers. This loan will increase his profit by 12 percent as well as his living standards.

loans.use: To buy stuff for resale in his provision store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells vegetables in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about fifteen years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of vegetables, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of vegetables, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Mary did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Mary sells provisions in Whindo (near Cape Coast). Mary is married to a driver and has two children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Mary has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more provisions to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Sarah did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Sarah sells groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. Her husband supports her business as a shopkeeper, and together they have three children. Sarah uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Sarah will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Sarah wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice is 39 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and where living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County has the second largest population of all the counties in Liberia.

She completed grade 12 before establishing her business, and she has lived all her life in rural areas. Traditionally, she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children who are between 2 and 18 years old. Only three are in school and they all live at home. 

For seven years now, Bernice has been running a table where she sells palm oil, vita, pepper and salt in the local market. She spends 9 hours each day on her business. A problem she faces is her small income, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, vita, pepper and salt for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita, pepper and salt for her business.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en:
Yah is 48 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County has the second largest population of all the counties in Liberia. 

Yah did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. Traditionally, she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have four children between 8 and 33. Only one of her children is in school and they all live at home. 

With a little money from her husband she was able to establish her table business ten years ago, where she sells palm oil, salt and pepper, etc. She  spends 8 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

One problem she faces is her small income, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esther is an entrepreneur. She specializes as a grocer in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for fifteen years. Esther is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Esther wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Esther plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Elizabeth is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Gladys did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Gladys sells provisions in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. As a divorcee with three children, Gladys uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Gladys wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi is a food vendor in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for fifteen years. Esi is married to a farmer and has eight children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Amistad está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante y también se comprometen a ser solidarias entre compañeras. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 16  señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con niveles de ingresos bajos, pero se están esforzando por mejorarlos.
Es la Sra. Fatima, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno por medio de su esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo está tratando de mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos usados, y gracias a la buena calidad de lo que vende, sumado a su simpatía, es que le va mejor cada vez.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas, ya que hace mucho calor y quiere tener prendas de verano para dar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La Amistad group is in its first loan cycle with the women’s committee programme, where all the women have committed themselves to working and helping each other in order to get on. They have also promised to show solidarity with their group companions. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where 3 of the 16 women are placed below the poverty line, that is, they are on a low income, but they are making an effort to improve their income.

Fatima, who in her survey came out with a poverty level of 1, is trying to improve by means of her effort and by her continual work. She sells clothes and second-hand shoes and, thanks to the quality of what she sells, in addition to her friendliness, matters are improving more and more. 

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in buying assorted clothing, as the weather is very hot and she wants to have summer garments to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of the raw materials she needs for her pieces, such as fine silver and natural gemstones.

Adriana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story: 

Born in Italy, Adriana has lived in Peru most of her life. "I began designing and crafting jewelry as a hobby, something to do in my free time when not looking after my daughters. But it snowballed and today I dedicate all my time to this craft."

"Knowing you value my art makes me happy and inspires me to continue creating new designs that will appeal to people all over the world. Thank you so much for your support by way of this microcredit."

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of the raw materials she needs for making her jewelry.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, his wife, and three children are Guatemalan silversmiths specializing in jade and sterling silver jewelry. They would like to purchase a diamond saw (used for cutting jade) as well as a stone polisher.

Pedro and his family have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story: 

"After working for silversmiths for six years, we decided to open our own workshop. We are all involved in the family business. We've developed a good working relationship. Everyone specializes in a different aspect and we complement each others' work."

"Cutting and polishing jade is the most laborious part of our work, which is why we appreciate your microcredit very much. It will allow us to purchase the equipment we need to replace the old ones that keep breaking down and slowing down our work."

loans.use: to purchase a diamond saw and stone polisher for their jewelry

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about ten years. She is married to a farmer and has six children. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries

loans.name: Pande

texts.en:
Pande is a Balinese artisan who carves wonderfully realistic animal sculptures. He would like to invest in raw material such as wood for his works. 

Pande has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I was born in a village well known for woodwork, and learned the art of woodcarving with my uncle. My favorite themes are the eagle and owl. It's a pleasure to be able to preserve such an animal in a carving. Animal sculptures are a great alternative, rather than endangering an animal's life by locking it up in a cage."

A message from Pande: "Thank you so much for your trust in funding this loan so I can buy wood and be ready for holiday season sales. To be prepared, I need capital to buy supplies and start production. I am happy and thankful for this opportunity, and hope it will help to let us keep working and keep our artworks alive. I hope you like my designs that I carved myself with love. Thank you!"

loans.use: to invest in raw material such as wood for his works.

loans.name: Sorry Heart Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sorry Heart” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kumba is the featured leader of this group. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Kumba sells palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), salt, pepper, rice, groundnuts, bananas, etc. and has been in business for 11 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm-oil, salt, pepper, rice, groundnuts, bananas, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.  

(Also attached on the right of the photo is a member of the group who was not present for a group snapshot).

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, salt, pepper, rice, groundnuts, bananas, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Even though Mary grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Mary is an entrepreneur. She sells provisions in Whindo (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. 

Mary is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Dorothy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bread in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Dorothy is married and has three children. Her husband works in construction. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Dorothy wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread. In the long term, Dorothy plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to produce and sell more bread

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Theresa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years.

Theresa is married and has three children. Her husband works in construction. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Theresa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Theresa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Diana is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling vegetables and pastries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years.

Diana is married and has two children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Diana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of vegetables and pastries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of vegetables and pastries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Roseline is 28 years old. She did not go to school and she is unmarried. She has a two-month-old child. With a little money from her older brother, she was able to start this business by selling palm oil, salt, sugar, etc. She spends 9 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

One problem she faces is her small income, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, sugar, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 40 years old and lives in Sanniquille the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources, and living conditions are much better than the capital city.  It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She completed 1st grade, and she has lived all her life in a rural area.  She is married, and her husband is a farmer.  They have six children. Her children are between 4 to 22 years old. With the little money she received from her mother, she was able to establish her business, 8 years ago.  She runs a table, where she sells palm oil, vita, and pepper. She spends 9 hours on her business, and faces no other problems except fewer goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, vita oil, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to one day move from a table business to a shop business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is thirty years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in Uganda. She has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, milk, and other foodstuffs. 

To help expand her business, Aisha is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her business by buying more stock and help Aisha generate greater profit and increase her income. In the future, Aisha hopes to be able to build a residential/commercial house of her own. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more stock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. 

Ama is married and has eight children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay for their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase inventory, that will allow her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands

loans.use: to purchase inventory, that will allow her to sell greater quantities of groceries

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 39 year old, and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources.  Living conditions are much better there than in the capital city Of Liberia, and it is the second largest populate county in Liberia. She stopped her education at 5th grade, and she grew up  in the rural area of Sanniquelle, She is married, her husband is a farmer, and they have seven children.  Her children are between the ages of 4  to 22.  She said,  three of her children are in school, and they all live at home.  

She received  a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business seven years ago. She has been running a small local shop where she makes and sells  local soap , palm oil, etc.  She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday.  A problem she faces is a small income.  She will use the loan to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic, etc., for her business

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Hector, tiene 30 años de edad, viven en unión libre con su esposa, tiene cuatro hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma,Cortes. Anteriormente trabajo como operario de Maquila y al quedar sin empleo puso su propio taller de reparación y elaboracion de calzado para damas, caballero y niños. Ha solicitado cuatro préstamo para invertirle a su negocio, actualmente solicito otro por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales para la reparación y elaboración de calzado como cuero,hilos,pegamento,plantillas etc.. Este préstamo le ayudar a mejorar el inventario y asi poder obtener mejor producción y  ganancias. Su meta es que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor educación y que su negocio mejore.
texts.en: Hector, 30, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. He has four children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. He previously worked in a maquila [factory in a free-trade zone], and when he lost his job, he opened his own workshop repairing and making shoes for men, women, and children. He has applied for four loans to invest in his business. Currently, he is asking for another 15,000 lempiras and he will invest it in materials for repairing and making shoes, such as leather, thread, glue, insoles, etc. This loan will help him to improve his inventory and that way he will have increased production and better earnings. His goal is for his children to have a better education and for his business to improve.

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes, like thread, insoles, glue, leather, etc.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: After graduating from high school, Augustina decided to set up her own sewing business in Whindo (near Cape Coast). With over ten years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funds. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more fabric and other supplies in order to fulfill her customers’ requests. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and other supplies in order to fulfill her customers’ requests

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is the second largest populated county in Liberia. Nimba County is rich in natural resources and its living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. 

Oretha is 40 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 19, all of whom are in school. She herself does not have schooling, but with a little money from her husband, who is a tailor, she managed to establish a business selling red palm oil for cooking. She learned from friends how to sell and spends 9 hours a day, 6 days a week on her business. 

Oretha faces challenges in her business, especially the challenge of earning a very small income. So she is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil to sell. Her plan is to one day build a shop. She is grateful to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en: Kou lives in Sanniquelle the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources.  Living conditions are much better there than in the capital city Of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. Kou is 32 years old, and she did not go to school.  She is unmarried, and has four children between the ages of  6 to 21 years old who live at home. With little money from her mother she managed to establish her business three years ago. She learned this business from her friends,  She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday.  A problem she faces is a small income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, vita, salt, etc., for her business. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, vita, salt, etc., for her business

loans.name: Carmen Aleyda

texts.es: Carmen tin 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida con su familia. Ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de pescado de diferentes clases. Las ventas las realizan en su casa, compra el pescado y lo revende a sus clientes que tiene en su aldea. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría y venta de cerdos. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar más pescado y vender. Ha mantenido su negocio activo  y  quiere seguir creciendo y con las ganancias va tener bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en: Carmen, 37, is married and has four children. She lives in the city of Esparta, Atlántida with her family. For six years, she has worked selling different kinds of fish. She sells from her home. She buys the fish and resells it to her customers in her town. She has always worked buying and selling. Previously, she raised and sold pigs. The loan she is asking for is her fourth and it is for 15,000 lempiras. She will use them to buy more fish to sell. She has kept her business alive and she wants to continue growing, and her profits will provide for her and her family's comfort.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Even though Elizabeth grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She makes and sells soap in Whindo (near Cape Coast) in Ghana, West Africa. Elizabeth is married and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her soap inventory.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells groceries in Whindo (near Cape Coast). She was in school until the end of junior high school.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is an electrician. Efua has been working in this enterprise for eleven years now. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current inventory levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her grocery enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Kuna

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Kuna is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Kuna is married and has one child. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kuna wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Kuna plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell greater quantities of fish

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is forty years old. She is a single mother of seven children. 

Emily runs a retail shop and small hotel in Olenguse, which is near the town of Kapsabet. She has been making a living through these businesses for the last fifteen years. Her average monthly income is Kshs. 40,000.

This is her fifth loan of Kshs. 100,000. She plans to use the loan to pay for additional stock for her retail shop and hotel. She will purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat, cooking oil, rice, and other items.

She will use the business profits to pay her children’s school fees. Her dream is to expand her businesses and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquille the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources.  Living conditions are much better there than in the capital city Of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in a rural area.  She is married, her husband is a farmer, and they have a three-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. With a little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business in 2010.  She has been running a small local shop where she sells pepper, rice, oil, vita, etc., and spends 9 hours in her business, from Monday to Saturday.  A problem she faces is a small income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, vita, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, vita, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ndable

texts.en: Ndable is divorced and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ndable is a successful businesswoman. She sells beans in Whindo (near Cape Coast) in Ghana. She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ndable uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ndable will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of beans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ndable plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of beans that she can sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling shoes in Whindo (near Cape Coast) in Ghana. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Cecilia is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Cecilia wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of shoes. In the long term, Cecilia plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her shoe inventory.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Cecilia did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Cecilia prepares and sells fish for a living. She normally sells her fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about three years. Cecilia is married and has three children, Due to the fact that her husband is unemployed; Cecilia uses all her income to feed and provide for her entire family. She will use the loan to purchase a large amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Cecilia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to increase her overall sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Victoria is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Victoria is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Victoria wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Victoria plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of fish to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells firewood in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about twenty years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Afua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Afua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of firewood, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of firewood, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Even though Cecilia grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Cecilia is married and has five children. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Currently, Cecilia is an entrepreneur; she sells fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Cecilia wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Cecilia plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Afua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Afua sells fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Afua is married to a fisherman and has five children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. Afua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Joana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Joana sells beer and spirits in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years. 

She is married to a carpenter, and together they have two children. Joana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of alcohol, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Joana wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of alcohol, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married man. He has two children, ages two and four. He describes himself as a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals in life.

Fred is a tea farmer in Katunguru, which is in the district of Rubirizi. He has been farming since 2011. Fred started farming so he could earn some money to improve himself and provide for his family's needs. He works three seven-hour days on the tea farm. 

To earn more money, Fred also works as a public servant. However, he faces the challenge of delayed payments from both tea purchasers and the government. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 shillings to buy construction materials. The materials will be used to finish the construction of his house so that he can have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling vegetables in Whindo (near Cape Coast) in Ghana. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Mary is married and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of vegetables, which will help her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Femenil Group

texts.en:
The  rural  community  of  Xeabaj  in  the  department  of  Chichicastenango,  Guatemala  is  a  lush  green area  filled with corn fields and thick forests.  The pleasant smell of pine perfumes the air.  This  is  the  setting  where  eight  women  united  to  form  a  Friendship  Bridge  Trust  Bank  called  “Femenil”  meaning  “female”. Most of the women are 29 years old, and each has a tremendous desire to excel in order to support their families and their community. They are eager  to  begin their third  loan cycle,  which will be funded by KIVA investors,  with  Friendship  Bridge.  The amount requested will be used in their businesses which range from animal husbandry, small stores for daily consumption, textile production, and the creation of beautiful, embroidered handmade items. 

Petronila is one of the younger members of the Trust Bank.  She is 19 years of age and has two children.  Because  of  the  scarcity  of  financial  resources,  she  was  unable  to  continue her  education past the third grade.  Like  the  other  members  of  her  Trust  Bank,  she  knows  that  education is a vital key to a successful future and looks forward to watching  her children attend  school  in  the future.  Petronila raises animals and also owns a small store for daily consumption items. She needs more items on the shelves of her store. She approached Friendship Bridge for a new loan of $615 which she will use to buy more sugar, rice, noodles, pasta, bread, oil, and water.  In addition, she will purchase feed for the eleven turkeys that she is raising. She is most grateful to be a member of the “Femenil” Trust Bank for the working capital that is as necessary for her success as a business woman.  

The women of the Trust Bank meet once each month with a Loan Officer or “Facilitadora” from Friendship Bridge.  They   not   only  make  payments  on  their  loans  but  also  receive  valuable  trainings  on  subjects  like  women’s and  children’s health and  nutrition, family planning,  money  management and  savings,  women’s  rights  and  self  esteem.  The ladies send many blessings to KIVA investors and gratitude for funding their loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, pasta, rice, and more inventory for her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling alcohol in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Ama is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to better serve her customers. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory allowing her to better serve her customers

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling yams in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Maame is married and has two children. Her husband works as a clearing agent. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Maame wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of yams. In the long term, Maame plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory in order to sell greater quantities of yams

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Angie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 63 years old, married, and has one child. 

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Anita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Arlyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Floserfida

texts.en:
Floserfida is 58 years old, married, and has eight children. Floserfida works very hard to provide for them.

Floserfida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Floserfida has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Floserfida would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 46 years old, married, and has one child.

Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenny has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jenny aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Monaliza works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a variety store.  Monaliza is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new equipment and other supplies for her internet cafe business.

Monaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and other supplies for her internet cafe

loans.name: Laloasi

texts.en: Laloasi is a 22-year-old married woman who has one child. She runs a business selling a variety of goods in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Laloasi has requested a loan to buy noodles, milk, laundry detergent, soap, chicken, rice, mosquito coils, cigarettes, and soft drinks for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, laundry detergent, soap, chicken, rice, mosquito coils, cigarettes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 28 years old, married, and has five children.  Three of her children are in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.ru: Несколько лет назад умер муж Кумринисо, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как она не имела достаточного дохода. Ей 44 года. Она кормилица  2 детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них.  Кумринисо имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более 26 лет работает в средней школе. Она имеет огромный вклад в сфере образования Таджикистана. Кумринисо воспитывала много учеников, и ее ученики работают в различных сферах. Кумринисо планирует построить дом для своих детей, так как ее настоящий дом имеет плохое состояние. Она старается, чтобы ее дети жили в хороших условиях. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, кирпич и т.п. для постройки дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Кумринисо хороший человек.
texts.en: Several years ago Kumriniso's husband passed away, and it was very difficult for her to cope with her family expenses because she wasn't making enough money.  She is 44 years old and the breadwinner for two children.  She is a light in the lives of these children and is their only hope.  Kumriniso has a degree in teaching and has worked for more than 26 years in high schools.  She has made a large contribution to education in Tajikistan - Kumriniso has taught many students, and her students work in a variety of fields.  Kumriniso plans to build a house for her children because of the poor state of her current home.  She is trying to make it possible for her children to grow up in good living conditions.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase building materials like cement, wood, bricks, etc. to build her home.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.  Kumriniso is a good person.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, bricks, and cement to build a house

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Norma requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy new equipment for her shop.

Norma has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her shop

loans.name: Faiilagi

texts.en: Faiilagi is a 39-year-old married woman, and has 7 children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Faiilagi needs a loan to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, and spears. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Faiilagi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, and spears

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is a  27-year-old married woman, and has 1 child. She runs a business selling fried chicken, chicken curry and rice, etc., in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Silia has requested a loan to buy chicken, cooking oil, curry powder, garlic, onions, rice, and foam plates. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cooking oil, curry powder, garlic, onions, rice, and foam plates

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Махбубы - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Махбуба занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махбубы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, а также имеет 0,98 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает подсолнух и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Бахтыгуль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махбуба обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Махбуба планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Makhbuba is 40 years old, married, and, together with her husband, is raising 6 children.  Makhbuba has a higher education.  Makhbuba's work in animal husbandry, beginning 13 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS, has been the main source of income for her family.
