Thanks to Makhbuba's hard work, she now has in her care 2 milk cows, 1 horse, and 0.98 hectares of land, on which she grows corn and sunflowers every year.  Makhbuba's monthly income is 20,000 KGS.  With the goal of continuing to grow her herd, Makhbuba turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows to fatten and resell.  Makhbuba plans to use profit from the loan to continue to increase the number of domestic livestock in her care, and also plans to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.ru: Файзинисо проживает в Спитаменском районе. Ей 22 года, замужем, имеет двухлетнюю дочь. Сейчас она опять в положении. Муж Файзинисо работает мастером штукатурщиком. Сама Файзинисо занимается скотоводством. Она в течение 4 лет выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Ей помогает ее тесть. Ухаживать и кормить коров Файзинисо научили ее родители. До замужества Файзинисо помогала родителям по работе на скотном дворе. На сегодняшний день Файзинисо может самостоятельно заниматься скотоводством. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов скота и тем самым увеличить поголовья животных. Файзинисо обычно откармливает скот в течение 30-35 дней, и затем ее тесть продает скот на скотном рынке.
texts.en: Fayziniso lives in the region of Spitamen.  She is 22 years old, married, has a two year old daughter, and is once again expecting.  Fayziniso's husband works as a wall plasterer.  Fayziniso works in livestock, and, with the help of her father-in-law, has been raising cattle to sell for 4 years.  Fayziniso's parents taught her how to care for and feed cows, and before getting married, Fayziniso worked with her parents in a barnyard.  Now, however, Fayziniso can work in livestock on her own.  She is taking out a loan to purchase a few head of cattle in order to increase her herd.  Fayziniso usually fattens the cattle for 30-35 days, and then her father-in-law sells the animals at the cattle market.

loans.use: to purchase cows and bulls for cattle breeding

loans.name: Karla Mercedes

texts.es: Karla, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace 3 años se dedica a la comercialización de productos de la canasta básica como ser manteca, jabón, carnes, café, azúcar, harina etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de producto como granos basicos,harina,azucar,jabon, manteca y otros,para comprarlos al por mayor. en una bodega, así venderlos a un mejor precio y obtener mejores ganancias, ya que su inventario en el negocio aumento. Su meta es construir un local solo para su negocinegocio.
texts.en:
Karla is 30 years old and lives her common-law husband and their two children. They live in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For the past 3 years she has been selling basic food items like lard, soap, meats, coffee, sugar, flour, etc. 

The loan Karla is requesting is for 10,000 HNL and she will invest it in buying products like basic grains, flour, sugar, soap, lard etc. in wholesale from a warehouse. Doing this she can sell the products at a better price and get more revenue. Her business inventory will also increase. Her goal is to build a place solely for her business.

loans.use: to buy lard, soap, flour, sugar, beans, rice etc to stock her business.

loans.name: Alina

texts.ru: Алине 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Алины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алина занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,6 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Alina is 29 years old, married, and, together with her husband, is raising 3 children.  Alina has a high school education.  Alina's work in animal husbandry and farming, beginning 8 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 20,000 KGS, has been the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to Alina's hard work, she now has in her care 2 milk cows, 1 horse, 20 sheep, and 1.6 hectares of land, on which she grows beans every year.  Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS.  With the goal of further increasing her herd, Alina turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep.  Alina plans to use profit from the loan to continue to increase the number of domestic animals in her care, and to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Kika

texts.en: Kika is a 42-year-old married woman with 12 children. She sells fresh fish in her community as a way to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business, and is requesting a loan to buy a life jacket, cooler and a new fishing net. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Kika has been a member of SPBD since 2001.

loans.use: to buy a life jacket, cooler and a new fishing net.

loans.name: Lagaali

texts.en:
Lagaali is 34 years old and married, with three children. 

She makes and sells German buns, meat buns, and pancakes to the local community. She has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, chicken, soy sauce, garlic onion, dripping oil, yeast and plastic bags. 

She joined SPBD in 2013. With her earnings, Lagaali will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, chicken, soy sauce, garlic onion, dripping oil, yeast, and plastic bags

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is single, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Carmela has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Carmela has been in this business for four years now, and she also earns income from charcoal retailing.

In the future, Carmela would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Sonia has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making.

Sonia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Sonia would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and married, with two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries, like bread, noodles, biscuits, sardines, and other miscellaneous items.

Lorna has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, like bread, noodles, biscuits, sardines. and other items

loans.name: Naychabubu

texts.ru: Найчабубу 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает двоих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Найчабубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Найчабубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Найчабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет 2,43 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль, капусту и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Найчабубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Найчабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Naychabubu is 57 years old, a widow, and, after the death of her husband, has raised 2 children and run a farm by herself.  Naychabubu has a high school education.  Naychabubu's work in animal husbandry and farming, beginning 31 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 8000 KGS, has been the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to Naychabubu's hard work, she now has in her care 2 milk cows and 2.43 hectares of land, on which she grows beans, cabbage, and clover every year.  Her monthly income is 9000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her farm, Naychabubu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase cows for cattle breeding.  Naychabubu plans to use profit from the loan to continue to increase the number of domestic animals in her care, and also plans to save money to pay for her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale is  46 years old and married, with six children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Losivale has requested a loan to buy a pickaxe, bush knives, a water gallon, chemicals, and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

With her profits, Losivale hopes to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a pickaxe, bush knives, a water gallon, chemicals and a rake

loans.name: Saufaiga

texts.en:
Saufaiga is 43 years old and married, with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Saufaiga has requested a loan to buy a chain saw, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals for her plantation. She is a new member of SPBD. 

With her profits, Saufaiga hopes to support her family financially.
"

loans.use: to buy a chain saw, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 45 years old and married, with seven children, three of whom are in school. 

Sally is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Sally has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Sally has been farming rice for five years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 39 years old and married, with four children, three of whom are in school. Agustina works very hard to provide for them.

Agustina runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Agustina has been in this business for 16 years.  She sells a variety of items, such as rice, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future Agustina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is 49 years old and married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jojie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Shee has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jojie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jojie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tereimoana

texts.en: Tereimoana is 36 years old and partnered with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Tereimoana has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs and plastic bags for her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tereimoana will help and support her family with their everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs and plastic bags

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en:
Faalagi is 49 years old and married, with seven children. She sells fresh fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Faalagi needs a loan to buy a new canoe, fishing net, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Faalagi has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new canoe, fishing net, and a cooler

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. She has a fishing business where she sells fresh fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan to buy a cooler, life jacket, snorkel gear and spears. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, life jacket, snorkel gear and spears

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 48 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She has been in this line of work for two years and also earns additional income by raising ducks. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 60 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan from NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en: The Jepun Sari loan group is requesting a loan so that it can raise the price of the piglets it sells by increasing the quality of its herd and the pork rolls their animals are used to make. The members of this group will help each other because some will raise the piglets while others will fatten them so they are ready to sell to make high quality pork rolls. Ni Ketut, who is a member of this group, will care for the sow and use her portion of this loan to buy feed and renovate cages. She hopes this new method will work so she and the Jepun Sari group will get satisfactory results. One member of this group is not in the photo because she was sick and unable to attend the meeting.

loans.use: buy feed and renovate cages

loans.name: Tiute

texts.en: Tiute is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She owns and operates a business venture, Elei. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Tiute needs a loan to buy fabric paints, stencils, brushes, paint roller, materials, and elei carved board. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy fabric paints, stencils, brushes, paint roller, materials, and elei carved board

loans.name: Mua

texts.en: Mua is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a sewing  business venture. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Mua needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, and needles. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, and needles

loans.name: Faapopo

texts.en:
Faapopo is a 43-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Faapopo needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, eggs, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Fapopo has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, eggs, and plastic bags

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and married with one child.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is 50 years old, married and the mother of one child. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is 38 years old and the mother of two children. She and her husband are aiming for a happy and successful life. They live happily in a rural community through farming. 

They plant rice and vegetables that they sell in the market. Jennelyn also buys and sells other various vegetables to sell. 

She always wanted to have big sales and has hoped to obtain a loan as added capital in the business. Therefore, she is asking the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy bitter melon, eggplants, string beans, bananas, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, and other kinds of vegetables to sell. 

She is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy bitter melons, eggplants, string beans, bananas, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, and other kinds of vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mailetile

texts.en:
Maletile is 44 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Maletile needs a loan to buy to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow,  a gallon water bucket, boots, and a chainsaw. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Maletile will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow,  a gallon water bucket, boots, and a chainsaw

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 58 years old and now widowed. He has eight adult-age children, and they live happily in a rural community where he also lives in a separate house. 

He is a farmer who has engaged in a hog-raising business for almost one year. He aims to improve the business by raising more pigs, but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 as added capital for the maintenance of his business. He will buy feed, vitamins,  and vaccines for his hogs. 

He hopes that this loan request will be granted in order for him to make improvements in his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Sulita

texts.en:
Sulita is a 28-year-old woman who lived with her partner and 1 child.  She runs a business selling food in her community, such as fried chicken, chop suey, and curry.  She has many years of experience with this business.  

Sulita has requested a loan to buy chicken, cooking oil, chop suey noodles, garlic onion, rice, and soy sauce.  She plans to use her profits to support her family.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cooking oil, chop suey, noodles, garlic onion, rice, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago es un joven emprendedor que, desde los 14 años de edad conoce el arte de la confección, pues ayudaba a sus familiares realizando diversas labores como terminación de prendas, pulido, entre otras; esta experiencia le permitió adquirir 3 máquinas para comenzar su propio taller donde presta el servicio de confección a terceros, elaborando uniformes deportivos para 4 entidades educativas del sector; durante algún tiempo alternaba su labor con el estudio, pues se encontraba culminando sus estudios secundarios y, hoy en día dedica tiempo completo a su taller, además cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleados directos; de esta forma ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Su energía y actitud positiva, el empuje y la dedicación con la que realiza su trabajo, le han permitido cumplir los objetivos que se propones; es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, entre otros) y realizará mantenimiento a sus máquinas; esto le permitirá contar con la materia prima para elaborar las prendas y poder cumplir oportunamente con los tiempos de entrega, además podrá agilizar la producción con maquinaria renovada, que le permita sacar productos con excelente terminación y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Todo esto dará como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que obtiene para seguir apoyando a su familia. Santiago desea continuar con su labor, acreditando y fortaleciendo aún más su taller, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de ampliarlo y generar más oportunidades de empleo directo, que beneficie no sólo a su familia, sino a las demás personas que influyan en esta ardua labor; lo que para él significa tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is a young entrepreneur, who ever since he was 14 years old, has known the art of making clothes.  He helped his family members do diverse jobs like finishing garments and putting on the finishing touches, among others.  This experience allowed him to get three machines in order to start his own shop.  In his shop he provides sewing services to third parties.  He makes sports uniforms for four educational entities in his area.

For some time he alternated his work with his studies because he was finishing his high school education.  Nowadays he works full time in his shop.  He also has help from two direct employees.  This way he has generated enough financial resources to contribute to his household’s finances.

His energy, positive attitude, drive, and the dedication with which he does his work have allowed him to fulfill the objectives that he sets for himself.  That is why he is motivated to request the loan to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons, among others).  He will also perform maintenance on his machines.  This will allow him to have the raw material to make the garments and to be able to finish his orders in a timely fashion.  He will also be able to streamline the production with renovated machinery, which will allow him to get products with excellent finishing and satisfy his customers’ needs.  

All of this will produce, as a result, an increase in the income that he gets in order to continue supporting his family.  Santiago wishes to continue his work.  He wants to firmly establish and strengthen his shop even more in order to fulfill his dream of expanding it and generating more opportunities for direct employment.  This will benefit not only his family, but it will benefit other people who have an effect on this hard work.  To him, this means having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons, among others) and to perform maintenance on his machines.

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote is a 45-year-old married woman with 5 children.  She has a fishing business in which she sells fresh fish in her community to earn a living.  She has many years of experience with this business.  Salote needs a loan to buy a new fishing net, spears, snorkel gear, and goggles.  She plans to use her profits to support her family.  Salote has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net, spears, snorkel gear, and goggles.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Farming is the primary activity of Rodrigo for about 10 years.  He works and operates a farming business.  He mentioned that if the harvest is good, he produces 120 cavans of rice every cropping.  But if it is not, he only gets half of that harvest.  Aside from farming, he also has a small furniture business as one way to earn additional income. 

Rodrigo is a 54-year-old married father of two.  They are living harmoniously in the town of Delfin Albano.  He wants to have a loan of PHP 40,000 as added capital for his farming maintenance.  With this loan, he will purchase agricultural supplies like rice seeds and fertilizers.  His earnings from farming are used for the improvement and expansion of his furniture business.  In this way, he is able to earn a higher income for the family’s future and daily needs.  This is especially since he and his wife are not getting younger.  He also wanted to make improvements to their house if he is able to make a good harvest on the next cropping.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and has five children. Teresita is married and one of her children is still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Teresita has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed fifteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Gellan

texts.en:
Gellan is 26 years old and married with two children.

Gellan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Gellan has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Gellan aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Soloau

texts.en:
Soloau isa  48 year old widow with 8 children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Soloau needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, rake, fertilizer, garden hose, gloves, and shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Soloau will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds,rake,fertilizer,garden hose,gloves and shovel

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is an industrious mother who plants and harvest vegetables that she also sells in the public market. She is 39 years old and has school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to continue financing their education and give satisfaction to her family daily necessities. She is asking for a loan of PHP23,000 as added capital for her vegetables buy and sell business. She plans to buy various kinds of vegetables like string beans, bitter melon, eggplants, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, and beans to sell. Despite the problems and difficulties in life, she has this strong determination in making further improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables like string beans, bitter melon, eggplants, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, and beans to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Rice farming is the primary activity for Anita for almost thirty-one years.  She earned a net income of PHP 5,000 on the last cropping, and these profits helped them to improve their way of living.  Due to insufficient funds, however, she would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for the land preparation of her rice farm.  She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation of her rice farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Buying and selling frozen foods is the primary activity of Marina.  She and her husband want their children to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday.  Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to earn more income in order to satisfy their necessities.  She plans to acquire more stocks of frozen foods to sell, but she does not have sufficient capital.  For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of longanisa, imbutido, bologna (pork sausages), and hot dogs to sell.  Patience and determination is the key to success, according to Marina.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of longaniza, imbutido, bologna (pork sausages), and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.es:
La Sra. Francis esta cursando el ultimo año de Profesorado de Danza Paraguaya y Española, su meta es llegar a ser una bailarina destacada y ser Profesora de danza y así poder enseñar a todas la personas que estén interesado en esta profesión. Su aspiración es ser una profesional y ganarse el pan de cada día con esta profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación y también invertirlo en sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Francis is completing the last year of her degree in Paraguayan and Spanish Dance. Her goal is to become a distinguished dancer and to be a professor of dance and through this work teach all of the people who are interested in this profession. Her aspiration is to be a professional and to earn her daily bread through this profession. She is seeking this loan to invest in her tuition expenses and to pay for her transportation expenses. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving which will help her a lot.

loans.use: to pay for tuition expenses and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh lives in Vanadzor with his family. He is married, and he has a school-aged son. It has been ten years since Mushegh first engaged in his jewelry making and designing business. He has a small separated workshop in his house where he spends time working there most of the day. Mushegh makes different jewelry such as rings, earrings, bracelets, and necklace. He also takes private orders. 

This will be Mushegh’s second loan from Kiva. The first one has helped him greatly, and he managed to buy some necessary materials for his business. 
This time Mushegh is asking for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy gold and some precious stones since he has already designed some jewelry and he has models of some new fashionable jewelry, the sale of which, he is sure will bring decent income.

loans.use: to buy gold and some precious stones

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is 20 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa with her family. Haneen is studying for a Bachelors of English Language and Literature and is in her 2nd year. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her field after graduation to start helping her family financially.  They are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old and from Nyandarua South.  He is married, and together with his wife, he is blessed with five children between the ages of 4 and 20 years old.

James is a farmer and has been farming for the past 5 years.  He has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers.  

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 50 years old and married with nine children. With three children currently in school, Gilda works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gilda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, canned goods, juice, milk, etc. 

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwaboya

texts.en:
Mwaboya has operated her shop selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business and in addition, she has a tailoring business to earn a living.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 70,000, which she will use to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Javen

texts.en:
Javen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Javen is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Javen has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Javen requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Javen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Javen would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with two children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from coffee shop.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a hard working mother who is engages in planting and selling of vegetables within their community. This is her way of supporting her husband in generating income. Due to hardship of living, she aims to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. She wants to acquire more kinds of vegetables to sell but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan of P5,000.00 to buy additional stocks of eggplants, pepper, bitter melon, okra, string beans, sweet potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. She hopes that someday, she will improve more of her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggplants, pepper, bitter melon, okra, string beans, sweet potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family. 

Melinda has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods like shampoo, hair conditioner, laundry soap, fabric conditioner, coffee and sugar to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods like shampoo, hair conditioner, laundry soap, fabric conditioner, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children still in school, Nina works very hard to provide for them.

Nina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, soy sauce, fabric conditioner and rice to sell.

Nina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

Nina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, soy sauce, fabric conditioner and rice to sell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a very young and nice lady of 22 years old who lives in a very beautiful and rich with nature city of Dilijan, which is in Tavush region. Gayane has a higher education and a specialty of a lawyer, and at this moment, she is in magistracy study. Despite of her young age, simultaneously she manages farming. 

She has in her farm two cows, two calves, twenty chickens, and a pig. As she says, her cows give good, tasty, and creamy milk, which sells to re-sellers or to the local cheese factories.
 
Gayane asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to increase her farm cattle breeding, and she plans to buy a cow and fodder for winter season.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for winter season, which will help her increase her farm cattle breeding.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 23 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his 5 siblings and parents. His father is a retired man. Odai is studying Animal Production, 4th year. He is planning to continue his study to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income, and help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has six children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

She has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Omar es un campesino de 43 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Nació en una humilde familia del campo que durante toda la vida realizaron labores agrícolas, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de plátano cuya producción es cosechada y vendida en el mercado de la región donde reside, generando de esta manera los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Su empuje, tenacidad y perseverancia, le han permitido sobrepasar las dificultades que se le han presentado, especialmente la competencia que existe en esta labor; sin embargo, motivado por su familia, él ha surgido poco a poco. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar los insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), de esta manera podrá cosechar productos de mejor calidad que incrementan la posibilidad de venderlos a mejor precio, aumentando así las utilidades que recibe por su labor. Omar, como todo hombre campesino, desea continuar con su labor, fortaleciendo día a día sus cultivos, lo que le permitirá tener una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Omar, 43 is a farmer and father of three children with his partner. He was born in a humble family who always worked in the fields. Thanks to that, he now has a plantain farm that he harvests and sells in the regional market, which gives him income to support his family's basic needs. His drive, tenacity and perseverance have allowed him to overcome the difficulties he has faced, especially competition from others in this work. Nevertheless, motivated by his family, he has risen little by little. 

Currently he asks for the support of a loan that will be used to buy agricultural inputs (compost, pesticides, fertilizers, etc) so that he can harvest better quality products which will increase the possibility of getting a good price for their sale, and therefore increase the profits of his labor. Omar, like all country men, wants to continue with his work, strengthening his crops each day, which will allow him to have financial stability and give his children a good education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (compost, pesticides, fertilizers and other things)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is borrowing a loan of 8,000 PHP that she will use to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine to fatten her pigs. She has been operating this business for six years.  Her husband operates a transportation business. She works hard to keep generating income in order to save for the security of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 58 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lucy has an E-Loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines. Lucy requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional prepaid load to offer for sale.

Lucy has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid load to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 47 years old and married with four children.  She helps her husband manage their farm to earn a living. She also has a plot of land where she plants and harvests vegetables, which she sells. She has been selling vegetables in the market for more than 10 years. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer. She is determined to provide a better life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a widowed mother of five children. She lives at her own house that has no electricity or piped water.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital for the business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira was born in 1975. She is married and a mother of 3. Her husband is a bus driver. Amira has been planting flowers and plants for 4 years. She started her project by planting a small amount of them. Now she wants to expand her project by raising the number of her plants and buy materials that help in growing them fast. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more planting pots.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Элмиры - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку авто.
texts.en:
Elmira is 44 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband. She has a specialized-secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Elmira's hard work, her farming business now comprises two dairy cows and ten sheep. She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Elmira has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows for breeding. 

Elmira plans to re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Absalón

texts.es: Absalón trabajó durante varias décadas como empleado en diferentes empresas de la ciudad; esto le permitió adquirir su pensión y, con el dinero decidió montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en la casa donde vive, aprovechando la ventaja de que la unidad residencial era muy nueva y no tenía competencia, por lo que comenzó a dar muy buenos resultados, gracias a la aceptación de los habitantes; allí trabaja todos los días de la semana, de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm y ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar. De esta manera ha generado los ingresos para sustentar las necesidades de su hogar en los últimos 12 años, tiempo que lleva funcionando el establecimiento. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un enfriador y surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, mecato, galletería, gaseosas, pan, entre otros), esto le permitirá cambiar el enfriador que posee porque se encuentra en mal estado y así podrá conservar mejor los alimentos, para ofrecer a sus clientes productos con excelente calidad, además de gran variedad de artículos necesarios para la canasta familiar; esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y de los ingresos que éstas generan, pues, a pesar de la competencia que ha llegado al sector, él continua teniendo su clientela fija.  Absalón sólo desea continuar con su labor hasta que su cuerpo y Dios lo permitan, manifiesta que desea dejarle un buen patrimonio a su familia y, por el momento su objetivo principal es disfrutar una vejez tranquila, al lado de su esposa y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Absalón worked for a variety of companies in the city for several decades, which allowed him to earn his pension.  With the money he decided to start his own business, a grocery store in the house where he lives.  He took advantage of the fact that the area was very new and there was no competition.  Thanks to the residents, he began to get very good results.

Absalón works every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., selling all types of staple products.  In the 12 years he has been running the store, he has earned income to support his household necessities.

Currently he's requesting the support of a loan to buy a cooler as well as provisions wholesale (dairy products, meat products, snack food, cookies, soda, bread, and other products).  This will allow him to replace his cooler, which is in bad shape, so he can better preserve the food and offer his customers products of excellent quality.  He'll also have a wide variety of staple items that families need.  This will result in an increase in his sales and his income because he continues to have steady customers despite the fact that competition has arrived in the area. 

Absalón wants only to continue working as long as his body and God allow him to.  He says he wants to leave a good inheritance for his family, and his current goal is to enjoy old age peacefully alongside his wife and his two children.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and supplies

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela, a sus 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Actualmente se dedica a vender productos por catálogo, además está realizando un curso de belleza y, desea iniciar su propio negocio, con el fin de generar ingresos para brindar el sustento a sus hijos y aportar a la economía del hogar. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar las herramientas de trabajo (plancha para el cabello, secador, cepillos, tratamientos capilares, entre otros) y, abastecerse de mercancía de catálogo (cosméticos, perfumería, cremas corporales, entre otros), de esta forma podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo y además podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, para satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, de esta manera espera generar buenos ingresos para continuar velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos. Marisela, con su empuje, empeño y dedicación continuará trabajando, pues su principal sueño es poder estar más tiempo con sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marisela, at the age of 30, is the mother of two children and lives in free union with her partner. At this time she sells catalog products, and in addition, she is taking a beauty course and wants to set up her own business, with the goal of generating income to offer sustenance to her children and support the household economy. With the loan that she is applying for, she wants to buy her working tools (straightening iron, dryer, brushes, and hair treatments, among other items) and stock up on catalog merchandise (cosmetics, perfumes, and body creams, among others). In this way she will be able to start her own productive project, and in addition she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers in order to satisfy the demand that increases in the approaching Christmas season. In this way she hopes to generate good income to continue watching out for the well-being of her children and advance toward the completion of her goals. Marisela, with her force, effort, and dedication will continue working,  since her principal dream is to be able to be with her children more and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy working tools (straightening iron, dryer, brushes, and hair treatments, among other items) and to stock up on catalog merchandise (cosmetics, perfumes, and body creams, among other items)

loans.name: Rossini

texts.en:
Rossini is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Rossini successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rossini's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
General store has been Dolores's business for more than 25 years. She simply lives with her husband and four children in their place in Cordon. According to her, her eldest child is already married, the other one is working, while the other two children attend school. She and her husband work hard to obtain greater income in order to sustain their family's basic needs and improve their financial stability. 

With her determination to achieve her goals in life, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 30,000. This additional capital she requested will be used to buy volumes of grocery items, such as soft drinks, biscuits, comfort foods, cooking oils, eggs and canned goods, for her general store. 

This amount of loan will enable her to satisfy her costumer demands and economize her fare expenses as she goes to and from the market to acquire  stocks. She knows that having this financial assistance has much to do with the improvement of her family living conditions, and with her ability to give full education to her two children.

loans.use: to buy volumes of grocery items, such as soft drinks, biscuits, comfort foods, cooking oil, eggs and canned goods for her general store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 20 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan, called Irbed, with his 2 siblings and parents. His mother is an English teacher, and his 2 brothers are working at a private company.

Mohammad is studying Design and Applied Arts, 3rd year. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his Masters’, find a job in his study field after graduation, start earning a better income, and help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Meet Charles, a farmer from the highlands of Kericho, a very fertile area where mostly tea is grown. He has been practicing farming for four years. He has a farm where he grows tea and rears dairy cattle. He gets his income from the sale of milk and tea. Not forgetting the fact that Charles really enjoys farming, he says that it is quite expensive to manage a farm – especially when one doesn't have a good capital base. He chose Juhudi Kilimo because they invest in farmers and he will be able to get funds to help him purchase poultry. Through the microfinance training, he learnt that microfinance institutions do provide loans to small-scale farmers. This loan will help him get poultry, thus, it will increase his income through the sale of eggs. This will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Shojoun

texts.en: Shojoun is 24 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her three siblings and her parents. Shojoun is studying for her Bachelors degree in English Literature.  She is in her second year. She is planning to continue her studies so that she can find a good job in her field after graduation and start helping her family financially.  Her family is currently facing a financial crisis, which is why they cannot help her pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Susana has been farming vegetables for 10 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik lives in the village Ddmashen which is in the Gegharkunik region. Satik is 51 years old. She graduated from medical college and for several years she has worked at the Sevan City Children's Health Center as a nurse. Satik is married, and she has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and they live separately; her son works at the police station. 

Satik’s husband does not work and together they are engaged in farming and agriculture. They have a nice and not a small farm; three cows, a bull, three calves, nine sheep, four piglets and 22 chickens. On their plot of land they cultivate mainly potatoes and sell it to resellers. Several years ago Satik’s husband managed to buy a tractor which they use for their own and they also help other villagers on their land cultivation activities. 

Satik is asking for a loan of 850,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a truck for her farm, which will help them greatly in their farming activities.

loans.use: to buy a truck for her farm

loans.name: Rosalyne

texts.en:
Rosalyne lives in Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 30 years old and a dressmaker. She is a single mother of a 12-year-old child. She has been in the business for the last two years. The business has been growing ever since she started it, and now she is asking for a loan to buy more materials for her business. 

She knew Milango through friends who invited her to join them so they can save and be able to access credit to fund their business. She has a vision of owning a large dressmaking shop in the next five years, despite the challenges of competition and high costs of material. The income she will raise will improve her standards of living and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more dressmaking material.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables farming business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her fruits and vegetables farming business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Enedina is 39 years old and married.

Enedina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Enedina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Enedina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she runs a tailoring business to supplement her living. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Sameera Group

texts.en: This group is called Sameera, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Samira is a 26-year-old single woman. She started a business selling fruits and vegetables with support from her brother. She is a responsible woman, and she works hard to earn daily income. Her business is not going well, due to a lack of money. To expand her business, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, Evelyne has operated her business, selling clothes to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is 55 years old. He lives in the city Stepanavan which is in the Lori region. Edik is married, and he has three daughters and a son. His daughters are married and they live with their families. Since Edik’s elder daughter lives with her family in the Russian Federation, his wife has gone there to visit her daughter and grandchildren. Now Edik lives with his son in their nice cute flat. Both of them work at the local gasification center as locksmiths.

They have decided to give a surprise to his wife and Edik is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian in order to buy a new refrigerator which will be a great and lovely gift for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator which will be a great and lovely gift for his wife

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 20 years of age, who lives with his father and his three brothers. Mouhammad and his father work together in order to provide for the family.
Mouhammad is a mechanic and owns a small garage. He specializes in fixing damaged body parts of any vehicle. He has been in this field since 2010 and has been growing rapidly in fame and experience. Thanks to his special services, Mouhammad has become well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling and to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide better income for his family.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work

loans.name: Nyambaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Nyambaatar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and a new born baby boy.  They live in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, on his uncle's plot of land in the Ih toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Ariunjargal is 20 and stays home taking care of their two-month-old son, Erdenebaatar. 
Nyambaatar graduated from college as an excavator driver in 2007, and he has worked as a salesperson in the auto retail business since then. He has just started his tire service business to increase his income, in order to cover increased family expenses. 
He is now requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase the necessary equipment and tools to start his business. He is dreaming about expanding his business, purchasing a plot of land, and building his own house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary equipment and tools to start his business

loans.name: Kuñs Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña guapa 2 está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, trabajando todas juntas para poder ayudar a sus familias e ir superando las limitaciones que tienen.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Epifania quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que esta con un nivel de ingresos bajos, pero trabajando por mejorar su vida. Ella vende ropas como medio de subsistir y es así que está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Dice que es muy difícil ya que hay mucha competencia, pero que lo hace por su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar distintos tipos de prendas y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, además de poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: The group called Kuña Guapa 2 is in the second cycle of the program of the committee of women. They are part of a program for the eradication of poverty. The women work together in order to help their families overcome the limitations they have. One of the members is Mrs. Epifania who showed in her survey a level 1 of poverty, which means that she receives a low income but that she is working to improve her life. She works selling clothing in order to survive and that is how she is fighting to improve her life. She says that it is very difficult because there is a lot of competence but that she is doing it for her family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy different pieces of clothing to continue with her sales like she has been doing, as well as to continue to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase different pieces of clothing for sale

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en:
Zulfa is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Zulfa has owned a food stall business; neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. Competition is a major challenge in her business.

Zulfa wants to use the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase stock such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a café business.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Guljamila

texts.ru: Гулжамиле 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гулжамили- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулжамила занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамили, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 15 овец, а также имеет 3,72 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжамила обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Guljamila is 51 years old, married, and raising five children with her husband. She has a specialized-secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Guljamila's hard work, her farming business now comprises two dairy cows, two heifers and fifteen sheep.  She also grows potatoes and beans annually on 3.72 hectares of land. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Guljamila has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows for breeding.

Elmira plans to re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 40 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Vivencia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vivencia has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 22 years old. She lives with her son and her husband in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. Her husband is in the military.

Alaa is studying for a bachelor's degree in Children's Education and is in her third year. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her field after graduation so she can start helping her husband financially. She applied for this loan because she and her husband are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a mother of 6 children, lives in the very rich highlands of Kericho, Kenya.  She is a very dedicated farmer who has been farming for 16 years.  She has a piece of land where she grows tea, crops, and also dairy farms - and makes a sustainable income from these activities.  She loves taking care of her livestock, but it is very expensive to maintain them because of animal pests and diseases.

She chose the Juhudi Kilimo field partner because they are easily accessible and they give loans at a low interest rate.  When asked what she learned from the micro-finance training session, she said that it develops a lifestyle of saving on small scale farmers.  This loan will enable her to purchase poultry to raise and start producing eggs for sale.  This will increase her family's income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Emteyaz

texts.en: Emteyaz is 21 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her 5 siblings and her parents. Her father is deceased and her mother works at a governmental entity.  Emteyaz is studying for her Bachelor of Business Administration and is in her 4th year. She is planning to continue her study to find a good job in her field after graduation to start helping her mother financially.  Since her fathers’ death, they are now facing financial crisis and have had a hard time paying her semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ayshahar

texts.ru: Айшахар 63 года. Она из села района Кубодиён. Айшахар со своей семьей занимается растениеводством, посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Сейчас она решила параллельно начать собственный бизнес. Айшахар планирует заняться откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота. У нее имеется опыт в выращивании скота, так как в ее хозяйстве имеется корова для нужд семьи, и за этой коровой она ухаживает сама. Начальный капитал Айшахар составляет 200 долларов. Поскольку этой суммы недостаточно, Айшахар обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму от кредита и собственного сбережения хочет купить трех бычков и корм. Она собирается откармливать их в течение 30-35 дней и затем продать на том же скотном рынке, где она купит их. С помощью кредита Айшахар сможет начать и в дальнейшем продолжить новый бизнес, который обеспечит ее на старости лет новым источником дохода.
texts.en:
Ayshahar is 63 years old. She comes from a village located in the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  Her family is involved in farming and sows agricultural crops.  In addition to farming, Ayshahar has decided to start her own business and would like to get involved in fattening and selling cattle.  She already has some experience in animal husbandry because her family owns a cow for their own need, and Ayshahar is the one taking care of that cow.

Ayshahar has an initial capital of $200.  However, she is taking a loan because this amount is not sufficient.  With her loan amount as well as her personal savings, she wants to buy three steers and some cattle feed.  She plans to feed her cattle for a period of 30 to 35 days and then resell them at the same cattle market where she bought them.

Thanks to this loan, Ayshahar will be able to start and develop a new business, which will guarantee her a new source of income in her old age.

loans.use: to buy three steers and some cattle feed to start fattening and reselling cattle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has 6 children. Ali is the sole provider of the family and works hard to provide all of his family's needs.
Ali owns a big motor generator and provides his neighborhood with electricity. He has been practicing this business since 2011 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has a hired an employee and is becoming well-known in the neighborhood and has gained an excellent reputation.
Ali is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a piece of equipment to install on his motor generator. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment to install on his motor generator.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité “Virgen de Lourdes” se formó con la iniciativa de la una de las integrantes, que quiso poder ayudar a sus compañeras, y también a su familia, esta comunidad es de una zona humilde y rural de la ciudad de Curuguaty, donde las integrantes en su mayoría se dedican a trabajos de campo.
Sandra es una de ellas, y cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, con lo cual está luchando para poder dar a sus familias lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha diariamente por salir adelante y e ir mejorando su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en: The Virgen de Lourdes communal bank was formed thanks to the initiative of one of the members who wanted to be able to help other women in her community and also her family.  This community is in a poor, rural zone of the city of Curuguaty and the majority of the members work in agriculture.  Sandra is one of these, and she says she raises and sells farm animals.  Through this work, she strives to give her family what they need to have a decent life free from hardship.  Sandra is a very hardworking person who strives daily to get ahead and improve her life.  She requests this loan to be able to buy feed for her animals so she can keep working and striving.  She is thankful to receive this opportunity to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Nadi Group

texts.en:
Nadi group consists of five ladies from Hodeidah, Yemen.  Awsh is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, and she is the leader of the group.  She completed elementary school but did not continue because she was married at a young age.  Her husband's monthly income is not enough to cover all of their living expenses, especially food and rent. 

Therefore, because she has the ability and skills needed to expand her business as a seller of incense, cosmetic materials and perfumes, she has requested a loan of 15,000 YER to help her buy incense, cosmetic materials and perfumes.  She wishes to open a savings account with AMB when she makes a good profit and becomes well-known in the market.

loans.use: to buy incense, cosmetic materials and perfumes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her child.

She operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Nyamtseren

texts.en:
Nyamtseren is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They have a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bat-Erdene, is 38. The couple has been running their family business of clothing retail sales, in a local market. Their three children are all local school students.

Nyamtseren began retail trading of consumer goods in 2006. She bought a big container with her business revenue in 2008, which she operated as a clothing shop for several years. During summers, she sells clothing by traveling to the countryside by car. She has gained much business experience over the years. Recently, she rented her container stall to another retailer. She began to sell baby clothing, since there are very few baby clothes retailers in the province center and demand is high.

She is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT. She will use this amount to purchase baby clothes for her business. She expects to increase her income and to start saving for her children's university studies.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothes to resell at her business

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia.  Her husband helps her run their family business and her son is a local school student. 

Sarantsetseg has been running an imported clothing sales business in the local market since 2008 with the help of her husband.  They also have small pig farm and grow organic vegetables on their plot of land.  She and her husband are open-minded, hardworking and determined people. 

She is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install in her home in order to stay warm during the harsh cold winter of Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install in her house.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in the city of Stepanavan, which is in Lori region. He is 55 years old, and he is married. Gagik has two sons, and both of them are married and live separately. In his flat, Gagik lives with his wife and retired mother. Gagik’s wife works at the local post office. Gagik, himself, works as a locksmith.

Unfortunately, last year Gagik’s father died. Now Gagik has some financial problems, and one very important, unsolved problem that could be solved by the help of money. To solve that problem, Gagik asks a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams. He will use the loan amount to buy and place a tombstone in memory of his father, in a city cemetery.

loans.use: to buy and place a tombstone in memory of his father, in a city cemetery

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en su 4to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza y aplicando la encuesta de los 50 indicadores de pobreza para conocer como están todas.
Forma parte de este grupo la Sra. Lilian, quien en su  encuesta mostró estar en el nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos. Ella vende prendas variadas, y con este trabajo quiere ir mejorando sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara a seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan y que no pasen por necesidades. Ella desde joven ha trabajado, y es por eso que está creciendo cada vez más.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas y mejorando sus ingresos para ayudar a sus familiares que dependen de ella.
texts.en: The Santa Librada group is in its fourth cycle of the women's communal bank program, in which all the members committed to working and helping each other to get head.  These women are in the poverty elimination program and using the survey of 50 poverty indicators to distinguish their individual circumstances.
