Lilian is a member of this group whose survey indicated that she is at level one, meaning she has a low income.  She sells clothing and wants to increase her income from this job which will help her to continue providing for her family and preventing hardships for them.  She has worked since she was young and this is why she is continuing to grow.  Lilian requests this loan in order to buy assorted clothing with which to continue her sales and increase her income so she can help family members who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy assorting clothing to sell

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Because Maysoon is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Maysoon was born in 1975. She is married and has six children. Maysoon has been helping her husband in his project for the past 25 years. They collect small boxes and tanks, recycle them, and then resell them to plant nurseries, fruit growers, and the like. They were considering this job as saving the environment from being polluted.

Now they are receiving requests from their customers for a larger amount of small tanks and boxes than they can collect. So they need to buy a larger amount of them, in addition to expanding their storage, to be able to keep a larger amount of their products. Taking these actions will help them to make a better profit and to raise their income, to be a good support for their children. But they don't have enough money to do these things. For this reason, Maysoon applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of the boxes and tanks she sells, and to expand her storage space

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Encarnacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en:
Fizuli is a photographer and he is 47 years old. He is married with two children. His family lives in Mashtaga village in the Baku region. One of his children is a 21-year-old girl and she is student. His son, Arif, is 18 years old and he is a student, too. His wife is a housewife and is 45 years of age.

Previosly he took a loan from Komak to buy a new computer for his own photo studio. As shown in the picture, he bought a new computer. Now he applied to Komak for a loan amount of 1,350 AZN. For this loan, he wants to buy a new photo printing machine.

He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. Fizuli hope that this loan will help to increase his business. In the future, he wants to repair his photo studio.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: Abed Al-Lateef

texts.en:
Abed Al-lateef is a 26-year-old from Gaza. In 2010, he opened a workshop to sells and repair mobile phones, and from 2010 until now he has sold and repaired mobile phones.

Abed Al-lateef is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy a billboard outside the shop and make new decorations.  This will help him to take a step forward and make his shop well known.

Abed Al-lateef wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success. He believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy a billboard outside the shop and make new decorations

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres se encuentra este grupo, ellas son de la ciudad de Luque, y vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento, es por eso que se han unido. Son jefas de familia que decidieron salir a luchar por sus hijos.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Maria, quien es decoradora de eventos, comenta que hace todo tipo de decoraciones para eventos, y que esta es la forma en la que ayuda a su familia y logra obtener los medios para cubrir los gastos del día a día. Es una persona bastante trabajadora, que también participa de manera activa en las capacitaciones.
La Sra. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas y otros artículos decorativos, para que así siga ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
This group is in its ninth cycle of the women's communal bank program.  The members are from the city of Luque and they saw a great opportunity for growth so they formed this group.  They are breadwinners in their families who decided to go out and work hard for their kids.  

One of the members is Maria, a decorator for events.  She says she make all kinds of decorations for events and that this is how she helps her family and obtains the means to cover her day to day expenses.  She is quite a hardworking person and also an active participant in trainings.  Maria requests this loan in order to buy fabric and other decorative items so she can continue offering a good service to her clients.  She is thankful to have this opportunity to continue growing and improving her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other decorative items

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro, being already greatly supported by Kiva lenders, has decided to ask for a second loan. This time she has decided to increase the number of her farm animals and she asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several bulls and sheep.

As she used to, Maro lives with her family in the village of Shishkert, which is in the Syunik region. She has two daughters and both of them are employed. Fortunately Maro’s husband continues to help her in farming and agriculture and together they perfectly manage to breed their farm animals: cows, calves and chickens. Together they also organize the sale of the harvest from their plot of land and their farm products as well at their city wholesale market: potatoes, different vegetables, sweet and tasty fruits, milk (dairy-products), meat, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and sheep in order to increase the number of her farm animals

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf was born in 1989. She is divorced and lives with her 12 siblings and her parents in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour.

Afaf has been selling accessories and cosmetic products for 3 years. She started her project with a small quantity of her products. Now she wants to raise the amount of accessories and cosmetic products she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her and her family, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelly is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase raw materials for her mat weaving.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money so she can continue to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her mat weaving

loans.name: Capitan Insfran Group

texts.es:
Capitan Insfran es un grupo nuevo, esta en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, y están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer en que nivel esta cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Es parte de este grupo la Sra. Yenny, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir, mejorando de a poco por medio de su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la costura y por medio de su esfuerzo se ha ganado una buena clientela que siempre le acerca pedidos y quedan muy conformes con lo que ella hace. Su sueño es poder tener un taller bien equipado y así poder seguir trabajando y tener una mayor clientela.
Ella pide de este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar telas, lo que le ayudará a seguir trabajando y luchando por poder crecer y mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Capitan Insfran is a new group which is currently in its first cycle of the committee program. They are taking part in the poverty elimination program, and are undertaking the poverty elimination survey in order to know the poverty level of each member and prepare them to work accordingly.

One member of the group is Yenny. Her latest survey showed that she is in the third level of poverty, i.e. she is improving little by little through her work. She works as a seamstress and through her efforts she has earned good customers who order regularly and are very satisfied with her work. Yenny's dream is to have a well equipped workshop so that she can keep working and gain more customers.

Yenny has asked for this loan so that she can purchase fabrics, which will help her keep to working as she strives to grow and improve life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for making clothes

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old and has four children. Mary Jane is married and two of her children are still in school.

Mary Jane is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been fattening pigs for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en: Duaa was born in 1992. She is single and lives with her parents and five siblings in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Duaa has been working at her mini-market for two years. She started her project selling simple products such as toys, candy and juice. One of the obstacles she faces is lack of the products that her customers request. Now she wants to buy more food products and accessories for her mini-market and a refrigerator where she can keep cold drinks. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products and a refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Otieno

texts.en:
Otieno is 26 years old from Migori county, located in the Western part of Kenya. He is married to Eunice and have no children yet.

He is in the fast-food business where he makes and sells French-fries (chips).He has done this business for the last 5 years, and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Otieno has requested for a loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to expand the business. Otieno will use the anticipated profits to add more stocks of potatoes.

His dream is to grow in his business.

loans.use: to add more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for four years. Helen earns more income from raising livestock.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store
